4W0j0hSr0A9Bcd2Wp1-3EQ.text: Great place. In from Chicago to visit with family. Nice surprise! Top notch.  Located on Washington Rd in downtown Mt Lebanon right in the thick of things. Great location, great food, great service, prices as expected. Highly recommend.

YEBX8gksPT44Bgk7lsbo_w.text: Perfectly acceptable thin crust wood fire Oven Pizza. Interior is somewhat dated and noticeably Rundown, but not horrible. The other food and wine list are also pretty good. Solid 4 * kind of place

eeMK_k-SFduOsKLs7U_PtQ.text: What a strange experience - I travel for business and walked in and asked to see the menu. The hostess wasn't very friendly & I tried to make light conversation about the weather... I'm in sales it always works. I thought she must not of heard me as she didn't respond? I then asked to be seated - the manager or owner no smile & without a word pointed to a table. I read through the menu, decided what I wanted, checked my email, then checked Facebook... when the waitress no smile, no greeting came over and asked if I wanted something to drink and seemed disappointed when I just asked for water. Terrible... I eat out almost every night of the week. The food may be good... It may even be great, but I can't get passed the not friendly part.

JpJoXq-Vf3zemtOJKn74kg.text: Everything was pretty average to be honest. Service was good, server was attentive and knowledgeable. But the food did not live up to my expectations, especially the pizza. Given this place is known for its pizza, I was a bit let down, average italian pizza at best. The homemade pasta was nothing to write home about either. Ordered the tortelloni and capelletti. Pasta was too doughy for a fresh made nor the fillings were very flavorful. Everything was also a bit too pricey for what you are getting.   3 stars for food 4 stars for service

YOtGNOeJkShNzNhCh-EyLg.text: I came here with quite a large group for a birthday. Half of us were there early and the others staggled in (which is so inappropriate, but what can ya do?), and this meant no free bread for like 45 minutes. Yes, I'm very much into the bread basket.   So let's talk about that! The bread was fresh and soft, and the olive oil was perfect with it. Yeah, we inhaled it.   We ordered the quattro formagio. It was so wonderful with great flavor and melty goodness. I asked for mushrooms on my part of the pizza and they kindly obliged with a ton of deliciously cooked mushrooms. They have to be the best I've ever had.   While I do suck at remembering what wine was ordered, it was a yummy white! I can't drink much, but I'll take little sips for special situations.   Our server was also phenomenal. He kept 16 people happy and handled various diet needs and requests like a champ.  I guess my main issues with this place that resulted in 4 stars versus 5 are:  Service was slow even for tables without 16. They should have brought the bread sooner. The bathroom had no toilet paper at one point.   I would eat here again if the opportunity presented itself! I'm glad I got to enjoy a great meal with friends at a new place!

Cb996MoyJIzIR0keR5LZXQ.text: Let me start by saying my wife and I walked in and I had to approach hostess to put our name in. Shouldn't it be the other way around?gave my full name of which I watched her type it in, took my phone number and told us an hour wait. Fine, we went down the block to the Saloon for a couple beers( awesome). Got close to the hour mark and headed back to Pizzaiolo. Approached different hostess with our name and was told they don't have my name listed. Are you f....en kidding me. We saw many open tables so they sat us immediately. Was told hostess was new, really? Can't put in a name correctly in an IPAD! Sat for over 5 min at table before our server came over. So first and second impression are you're terrible. Pizza was very good, just disappointed in service and hostess for my first time here. Food very good, maybe I'll give them another try sometime.

xCv1BEJSGeUbZ5dnD9yTrw.text: I've been here many times for birthdays my anniversary business lunches. I don't do dairy and have no issue finding non dairy Italian dishes.

SJsL54CAOIkM1eU1rIvfWw.text: Solid 4.5 Italian restaurant- came here on a Friday night with a good friend of mine to hang out! The front of the restaurant seemed like a fancy restaurant packed to the brim with people and having a classy/clean atmosphere. But the back part of the restaurant had a completely different feel to it!! Dimmed lights - light up bar - in a very tight space- but it was cozy and quant as well with a fireplace.   The waitress was super attentive and helping us decipher the menu and getting us what we wanted. One objection I have with Italian restaurants are that their menus are Italian which puts me into translation mode because I'm far from Italian- just a joke.   The food was very fresh in authentic- exactly what lasagna should taste like. Pasta was made fresh and cooked to perfection- sauce was on point- and oooohhh the cheese. I ate it all in 5 mins- may have not even used my silverware and just stuffed my face into it! I went there after working out and was starving- probably could set a world record for eating- the fact the food was soo good definitely helps.  Great place for a date night . Get a reservation- we were lucky we got a seat !

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vh9su6P7eJSHm4qpQL-95w.text: I rarely go to Mt. Lebanon to eat but my friend took me here on a dinner date!  First of all he made reservations online and specified he wanted seating outside on the patio. When we got there they did have seating available but not on the patio/courtyard so we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated where we wanted.  Next they guided out back to the courtyard which was beautiful. They had nice big trees covered in lights with statues and flowers around. The building had green vines growing up the side of them, was like a little slice of Italy in someone's back yard! It was romantic and quaint little area. We enjoyed it immensely! Only thing that bothered me was customers a few tables over we're obnoxiously loud and talking to the neighboring table across from them since they ran into people they knew.  Now onto the food we got served bread which was ok. Basically their pizza dough with olive oil and a small sprinkle of parsley. It was good but could of been spruced up a bit with some more flavors. My companion orders the lasagna which was delicious and cooked perfectly. It had a nice balance of cheese, sausage, and noodles. Then I ordered the gnocchi verde which was to die for!! The gnocchi has spinach and ricotta cheese mixed in it covered in a delectable sage and butter sauce. I have to say it was the best gnocchi I ever tasted!! I highly recommend trying this dish some point in your life time! The gnocchi just melted in your mouth and was so flavorful.   Overall the food was fantastic! Only reason I gave 4 stars was having to wait for the seats we wanted, the bread could of been spiced up a bit,  and I didn't like how I had to walk past the servers area ( putting in people's orders and talking ) to get out to the courtyard.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi Verde
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lasagna

3WSK2AN1wslrlzXhL7Ve3g.text: A little overrated if you ask me.  The drinks were tasty and the food was good... but there was really nothing special to validate the high prices.  Our service was a little slow, and I was delivered the wrong drink- so it took about 30 minutes before I got the cocktail that I ordered.  For a $12 cocktail, that isn't really acceptable. I was also surprised that you cannot reserve patio tables.   Again, no problems with the place, but it is pricey for what you get.

VYhtydFkM_ZrS_vws3CqxQ.text: Absolutely the best pizza!  We sat out back on the patio.  Even though it was a very hot day the patio was shaded cool.  I had a Margherita DOC pizza and it was delicious!  We also ordered the meatball appetizer and insalata misticanza.  Our waiter was named Deacon.  He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and very attentive to our needs.  It was a perfect night.  You must try this!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margherita DOC
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Insalata misticanza and meatball appetizer.

lFx49gIOTFJMwUbquYzGIw.text: This place has a very pleasant atmosphere - I sat outside on the patio and it was very enjoyable.  I've also heard the wine bar is nice and cozy.  Most importantly, the pizza was excellent!

Eu_MGLtkM84Hso4pglH31Q.text: Il Pizzaiolo serves authentic and delicious pizza and pasta.  I highly, highly recommend eating in the "wine bar" out back - where the main restaurant is loud, bright, and crowded, the wine room is darker, more romantic, and closer to the bar.

rSYJqbq7cYssgyAaN3inMw.text: Caveat - only ordered pizza.  Service - 5 star, couldn't be better.  Atmosphere - 4 star, what the chain Italian places try to copy. The patio is super, shaded, surrounded by brick buildings, private.  Pizza - alas, so disappointed. The margarita pizza was not crisp! The ingredients were good but very salty and the tomato sauce retained a canned taste. The sausage and rapini pizza was at least crisp but still a bit salty with quality ingredients. When crispy the crust was the best part - noticeable salt taste which I usually like but with the salty toppings watch your blood pressure.   Price - 1 bottle root beer and 2 pizzas (6 thin slices each) for $42 including tip. 0 stars  Bottom line - would not go 5 minutes to pay this much for this little. Sorry, Il Pizzaiolo.

jKDGaBsIZ3N0qHs8pe4F8A.text: Excuse me for lecturing. I lived in Naples, and return every couple of years, so I know a thing or two about  Vera Pizza Napoletana.   Il Pizzaiolo is the best pizza place in the city, since the deeply lamented demise of Roberto's. HOWEVER, the Margherita DOC is not right. There is no place for parmigiano in a Margherita. If you want to use parmigiano, fine, but call the pizza something else. In my opinion, it is not an improvement. (If anyone out there knows more than I do, please correct me.)   The Antipasto Napoli, a mixed plate of vegetables, is excellent and authentic. In particular the eggplant and the zucchini are outstanding. I also get cravings for the arugula and proscuitto pizza.  The wine list is good, appropriately all-Italian, and over-priced. The wine bar in back is very cute, rather dark, and just as noisy as the front room. Nothing but hard surfaces back there. It would be SO nice if there was something to absorb some sound.  Still, this is a favorite place and the only place to get - if choosing carefully - the real Neapolitan taste.

Pc4crxA6eid04yEkaGHIAA.text: I live in Jersey so I know a good Italian restaurant when I eat in one, and this place is really good. We came on a slow weeknight and were seated right away. We ordered a meat and cheese platter to start, and it was excellent with different kinds of imported stuff that I can't pronounce but I can assure you did not go to waste. I had a pasta special which was made with sausage ragu and was absolutely delicious. My wife had a chicken dish which was on the plain side, but cooked perfectly and very tasty. They have a small all-Italian wine list, which I would describe as slightly north of reasonably priced ($40-50 a bottle and up), and as is the trend these days, they have a beer list with some interesting Italian "birra artigianale" selections. We wrapped up the evening with a cocktail in the wine bar out back which is a neat little space with a bar, a seating area with a fireplace, and a decent sized dining area.

heIGQN6MMkZfVf89CbPiGg.text: Ok...so, it's difficult to give this a star rating as I had a mixed experience. The caesar salad is one of the BEST I have ever had, but the pizza is one, if not the worst I have ever had. I ordered the margarita, sauce, cheese and basil. Well I think they may have run out of cheese and basil. It was a wet tasteless mess. I may return if craving a good caesar.

Ds8JlRVp--jT786zaMXL3A.text: They have the best tomato sauce ever!  The pizzas are to die for and the pastas are both creative and super fresh tasting while still being really yummy!

ypwiM1Oz2Q_-QXWwqO9gaA.text: This place used to be better.  It seems that the pizzas have gotten smaller over the years.  I remember coming here back when they opened and the pizzas were really good.  I went last Friday and the pizza was undercooked and very average.  I love their beautiful oven though.  They take credit cards now.

6FJl7idYDH2Vq0kQgF0HJQ.text: Amazing pizza. The crust is as it should be--chewy in parts, crunchy in others. The Margherita D.O.C. is always a good choice, but if you really want to travel to yum-yum land, get the Panna. With mushrooms, ham, mozzerella and a drizzle of heavy cream, it brings together flavors that seem made for each other.

isRzSg5FR2HoSlBoENf4rw.text: You won't find more authentic, quality, Italian food with fresher ingredients. I've traveled all over the country and this place really can't be topped. That being said, it's become VERY difficult to have a casual meal here for under $100 (2 people). If money was no object, I'd eat here every week. That being said, I find myself not going as much because I'd rather enjoy filet at Capitol Grille for the same price as a salad, pizza, and two glasses of wine at Il Pizziolo

pvg726N60JE9zjpTr2G2PA.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Sometimes the service is a bit slow, but the atmosphere is fun, the food is great, and so are the drinks you can get at the very cool wine bar in the back.

0UQKwNeZFEXCMYGPwCuxAQ.text: the BEST pasta vodka and margherita pizza in the universe! its worth the money and the extra calories! :)

Dzd-EMLVbo-lNzb93qyP3g.text: Amazing find.  The mozzarella is as fresh as it gets, the menu choices are terrific.  The service was excellent and the cappuccino was probably the best I have ever had.

M-JO9Rlva-NuchBw-kbBzw.text: Although there are plenty of new brick oven pizza places popping up in the burgh almost monthly, this is still the best.  Robertos is the only other brick oven that compared.  Now that Roberto is in the Village, NYC this is certainly the tastiest spot left.

FZEX_mHQp4QSgeUQwCezNA.text: We were so excited to try Il Pizzaiolo after hearing about it from so many people and reviews online.  We discovered after arriving that they will accept cash only until further notice.  Apparently this isn't a temporary problem because I saw the same sign on the door a few weeks ago, but assumed it was a one-night thing.  In the era of credit and debit cards being accepted everywhere (even McDonalds and 7-11) it seems inexcusable for a decent restaurant to make patrons withdraw money from an ATM before dining there.  I'm sure we will still try Il Pizzaiolo, but at the moment I'm extremely annoyed with them!  We made the sacrifce and went to Bistro 19 next door.

_2E3xm7XZws0DfgfyZqp4g.text: I don't get it, the pizza I had here was an over priced soggy mess with a burnt crust. The oven was way too hot for this type of pizza.

Ms3NIJ8Uu9_SU8P4sPH6vA.text: I would give this place 5 stars for their food because their food is very good. I got their Linguini vongole which was done perfectly and my brother's daily special (bucatini with braised pork) tasted fabulous. The ambiance is ok - it's romantic but definitely a bit too noisy but what do you expect out of a space so small. As nice as my waiter was, they didn't time our foods right (brought entrees out while we were still eating our appetizers) and they started to cleared the table when not everyone at the table was finished.  This wasn't that big of a deal but when you're at a trendy restaurant, you expect a bit more than what you'd see at the Olive Garden. Also, if you get annoyed with yuppy moms who bring their newborns and 3 yr old kids that 'behave really well', this place will get on your nerves. I got cut in line placing my name in for a table by some lady who felt entitled to cut in front of the several other ppl waiting bc she had a baby with her. Then I went to the back bar area where half the bar stool seating and the sofa sitting area was being taken up by children under 4 and baby carriages. Just beware of the self entitled yuppies that frequent this place and every nice restaurant on Washington Ave. the experience will lower your dining experience as it did mine!

yR1TDoSS45p4SrE03-nYIg.text: The location is super. The outdoor patio and wine bar are great. I think the pizza is not good due to the soggy crust. We have been their many times and every time I ask for crispy crust and get soggy.

LrDtRaAH6boNSUz9zvl_rA.text: After eating at Bistro 19 I was very excited when I saw that Il Pizzaiolo was right next door.  I had thought about eating here in the past but was always put off by the location.  That being said, I went to Il Pizzaiolo last night with my fiance, and I have to say I was very disappointed.  We started with the Caesar salad, which was OK.  The dressing was delicious, however there was very little of it, and we found ourselves eating entire bites of dry, flavorless lettuce.  It was also an outrageous $10 dollars.  Don't get me wrong, had this been an entree sized portion, $10 would have been more than appropriate.  However it was just a starter size, and should have been no more than $6.  We then shared their margherita pizza which had delicious flavors, but was incredibly soggy.  It was also fairly small, but that was almost to be expected.  It was $12 dollars, so the size was not necessarily a problem, however it was hard to enjoy such a soggy mess of a pizza.  We also shared a pasta dish which was INCREDIBLY overpriced.  At $17 dollars, I was expecting more than a small bowl filled with dry pasta.  It was homemade, and well made, however it was almost insultingly small.  We finished with tiramisu which was excellent, and appropriately priced at $8.  In all, I found the flavors of their food to be excellent, however i was horribly misled.  Not only was every menu I found online roughly $2 to $3 dollars cheaper than their actual menu, but there was a table next to us who ordered pasta and received an enormous portion, prompting us to order pasta.  It was only till later did we realize that they were employees who had decided to dine their for the evening.  We also had a serious problem with the timing of the food.  The service was great, however for a Tuesday night, I would have thought their kitchen could time the courses properly; we had barely started our salad when the entree's came.  In all, I don't think I will be going back to this restaurant, nor would I recommend anyone waste their time traveling out to Mt. Lebanon for average Italian.

LqWTeGYs2MZIWZoKW26OUw.text: Dinner& Movie: After the downpour, the thunder clapped, the lightening flashed, the skies parted and "date night!" arrived.  My date and I were told there was a 30-40 minute wait and after almost leaving, we made our way through the restaurant to wait in the wine bar.  Hmm a bit misleading.  It was quite humid and crowded.  I am patient and was in great company but...there were some negative moments.  On our way up the wine bar stairs,  I held the door as a hostess directed a party down the teeny stairs to their table, only to be squished by patrons coming up who thought I was there for their convenience and more than happy to hold the door as they pushed past.  Also some of  the patrons at the bar seemed displeased that new faces were coming in and did not seem to want to budge to make any room for ordering beverages.  Anyway, I do not drink so I had literally stand still (think sardines) until some people were seated elsewhere.  I was then able to find comfy chairs to sit in.  There were some appetizers sweating and/or floating in olive oil on the windowsill which I found a little gross.  A not-so-polite employee cleaned up the space and extra drink glasses around me.  Giving me a dissatified "thanks a lot" look that made me want to justify myself as not being the slob that left the glasses and plates!  But my date returned and relaxed with a glass of wine as we chatted.  We were seated surprisingly promptly.  We were lead to a small two top near the door.  While not ideal, it was do-able.  I had a salad and the pizza with te arugula while my date hads the fpur cheese.  I loved my pizza and besides one of the cheeses my date also enjoyed his pie.  The pizza crust was slightly sweet and baked just right. (Like I said, I really enjoyed mine and the food is why I gave 3 not 2 stars.)  Thankfully my date was able to help me finish my pizza and there was some to take home.  Our waiter was nice and somewhat attentive.  I did have to hunt him down for red pepper flakes, a refill on water and our small table became quite crowed and yet he did not remove the bread basket/plates.  I grew up in Mt. Lebanon and know that sometimes the neighborhood can be a bit "snooty-pooty" but I would go back.  But not on a Friday night and honestly it would not be in my first choice out of the other nearby restaurants.

AIOoklQzGSaSfH1AoxepvQ.text: Passing through town, tried this place bc of Yelpers. Was not disappointed, the pappardelle with sausage was awesome, pizza great, and don't forget the tiramisu!

8kFgUJqVE5am9c7nqpAh9g.text: I don't make it here nearly often enough *sigh*...  This place is sooo good!  A friendly fun atmosphere with great great great Neapolitan pizza.  I actually managed to order something other than pizza (a couple of pasta dishes) and that was fabulous!  My parents are not usually fans of Italian food, but even they agreed that Il Pizzaiolo had great food and didn't complain!  :)  The wine flights are also fun and affordable even if not the best wine.  Parking can be a pain at night and on weekends - probably because there is likely to be a line for this place...  try for lunch or an early dinner.

IIVn7l_tDzEnDXYx5cLRNg.text: Great atmosphere and cool wine bar. Had the DOC Margherita pizza which was excellent- the mozz cheese is flown in from italy every friday. Pricey but it is definitely worth it. A new favorite for me

tot80hQBMMQwN-N81yDLPA.text: If you want great pizza, drinks and a nice date-night atmosphere in Mt. Lebanon area - this is the place. I have been here a few times and it always delivers. I always eat and drink in the wine bar upstairs in the back; lighting is too harsh in the front restaurant portion - also, you run the risk of families, crying children, etc... But upstairs, now you're talking! I always tell my girlfriend that I feel like we are in New York City when we are in the upstairs bar, you are transported for a few hours and get to feel as though you are not just in a suburb of Pittsburgh, PA, no no, it is much more than that. Here is the magic words to unlock this experience -- Tell the hostess downstairs that you will wait for a table upstairs (you want to eat up there and you will be waiting there in the meantime) and to come find you up there when the table is ready, then go up and get a martini or glass of wine at the dimly lit blue bar and enjoy the candles and fire place, then enjoy the meal! (DOC pizza is always our go to). Enjoy

jv51vdymnhj2PlfIeOGxdQ.text: To my left, two Godfathers and a metrosexual. In front of me, a curious assortment of people discussing comparative religion (but mostly the new Pope). In front of me, a glass of lovely Barbera and a thin crust pizza with smoked provolone, basil and cherry tomatoes. The smoke flavor is overwhelming, the sauce insipid and the crust so weak that all the bits fell off my first slice. It is, in this New Yorker's opinion, a major pizza fail. BUT! It's a great Pittsburgh effort and for that reason I give it three stars. The service is stellar, and the effort admirable. Go. Order the antipasti (it looks beautiful) and keep the pie simple. And order some wine.

yLZUOEzI28F8abauiK0JAg.text: My very first review, be gentle, here goes:  Confession, I joined Yelp one time specifically because of this place!  Their Margherita pizza and Penne Alla Vodka are listed as my last meal for a reason!  Whenever I come here, I don't eat the whole day so I can enjoy my carb fest!  As reviewers have stated previously, the service is hit or miss at this establishment.  I have had days where the host/hostess has seated my party promptly and had the most efficient waitress/waiter during my stay.  Then there have been times where I've felt like a nuisance for my presence.  That said, the food is so divine that I really don't care, it's worth the chance!  As Kat M. stated in a previous review, the ingredients are all authentic and high quality and it is a stand out amongst many restaurants in the area.  The crust is chewy, with that  Neapolitan type char to the bread.  The Mozzarella is creamy and floats on top of the sauce in a gooey little pockets. The sauce, goodness the sauce, it's bright and delectably simple.  In fact, it makes my mouth water to think of it.  Their pasta choices are always on par as well.  I order the Penne Alla Vodka, no fail, every time.  I actually had to learn how to make my own because I had to cut corners on my budget at one time!   They always have nice drink selections, but I love that they serve the small Coca-Cola bottles with a glass of ice, it gives the experience that European touch!  It's affordable and delicious, definitely a no-brainer for a great, casual night out with friends.  I no longer live in the area and I still crave a weekend in the Pittsburgh area just so I can get a pie!  My friend from L.A. consistently gushes about her pizza and pasta that she had whilst she visited me almost four years ago!  "Oh, what I wouldn't do for some Il Pizzaiolo!"  I couldn't agree more.  It makes me want to check Kayak for some cheap tickets to PIT!

tGk3TQ8w7SREm4kJIrb9_Q.text: It's been several years since my last disappointing visit here . I am glad things have improved . Great selection of food with many varieties of pizza . Nice wine list . The restaurant is separated between front restaurant portion and wine bar in rear . It is a pricey restaurant and all parking is on-street or in a public garage .

oMcflFMg8neZc6QYtsTb7g.text: Poor service, incapable hostesses, undercooked pizza, undercooked pasta, weak version of eggplant parm, a beverage ordered that never arrived.  No domestic wines so no cabernet or chardonnay on the menu; we don't make good wines in CA?  Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how did you enjoy the play?  Friday night is apparently not the night to go.

P_CJ7I54DhyBOcalzWHXkQ.text: Finally - a Pittsburgh restaurant with a decent outside patio!  Patio is in the back, so you don't get all the road noise, and is quite pleasant.  In fact, we got seated in the back corner by the fountain, which is not a normal table, but one of those stone garden tables.  Despite not being the most comfortable of seats, it was by far the most enchanting part of the patio.  I thought the pizza was "eh." The dough was a little "doughy' for my taste.  I was significantly more impressed with my pasta dish, which was incredibly delicious, but also incredibly rich, so I had to leave about half of it.  I guess that's what I get for ordering pastas with cream sauce.  In summary - a cute place for a date if you can sit outside.  I didn't find the inside half as exciting.  I'll give them another chance on the pizza, but even if you don't have that, try the pasta.

JwSCQn86PwTmNqx46F7L1w.text: This place has the best pizza I've ever had besides Keste and Paulie Gs in NYC.  Wood fired greatness.  Expect to wait on weekends in a crowded wine bar.  FANTASTIC red sauce and olive oil.  Not extensive on the wine list but good by the glass selection. A gem in Pittsburgh.

TWLEtlnHwA6vonuRb9W4qQ.text: Expensive, but really great pizza. Honestly it's the closest I've had to real Italian pizza outside Italy. The little wine bar out back is fun.

zIpCDqOF2xOz-9brJA37FQ.text: Well I have had oven roasted pizza's in NYC and in SF.   So I expected much better... Our pizza was burnt.  After we finally got the blonde waitresses attention . We showed her it was black on the bottom.   It tasted like charcoal. We had Caesar salads before they were so-so.  But told our server we could not eat the burnt pizza. To our surprise they don't take the pizza off the check.....it's their policy. So we had to pay for a pizza we could not eat. We will never go back!!!

bD9NL8GPx--99fJrhSozKg.text: Margherita DOC, here I come!  After tasting this pizza, I almost told my family we had to move to the South Hills from 40 minutes away in the North Hills of Pittsburgh. I'm very happy I live in the same town, as many others have stated that they miss it from hundreds or thousands of miles away.  Service? Who cares? I've never had anything to complain about. Pizza is served quickly and another post says it's because it cooks in a 1000 degree oven in 30 seconds. I don't know if it's True but they do get it to your table in 5 minutes flat. The crust is the best anywhere. The DOC version of the Margherita has buffalo mozzarella cheese in little pools and sparse but excellent basil leaves. Google Margherita DOC or Margherita DOP and you'll see others around the world.  A great meal: Have the Margherita DOC and sit at an outside (back yard) table. You'll feel like you're in Italy.  I've found nearly exactly the same taste only twice: Once in Civitivecchia, Italy and once in Prague, Czech Republic at Ambiente Pizza Nuovo (across the street from the Palladium shopping center). I travel to Prague often and always look forward to their Margherita DOP. It is exactly the same pie as the Margherita DOC at Pizzaiolo. I guess the "Vera Pizza" at both the Prague and Pittsburgh restaurants is some kind of certification.  So I'm having some Pizzaiolo Margherita DOC in about 2.5 hours. Can't wait!

67FaynHq5B6ksP7ubgscdA.text: Still one of my all time favorite places to eat!!! I now live in New York City and haven't found anything like Pizzaiolo. This place is a real treasure!

3fpAmsSuEFNF29UUPpgwlw.text: My wife and I like this place. It's always crowded, but you can wait in the wine bar--if that's not also packed to the brim(which it usually is). The pizza is the best in the area--exquisite crust, nice ingredients. Pricey, though. And parking is a pain. Luckily, Mt Lebo parking tickets are like $7.00, which is what you'd pay at a downtown garage anyway.

eBUSzYZn3r1b3qDqQNkGKg.text: I love this place. It gets busy on the weekends, with waits well over an hour sometimes, but that should be a sign of its exceptional quality. They have a wine bar in the back where you can grab a drink while you wait, or you can also head down the street to one of the other bars on the street until they call you to tell you your table is ready. That usually makes the wait seem very reasonable. We happen to live within walking distance so we have frequented this restaurant probably more often than we should, however, we have not had a single bad experience here and that is why we keep coming back. I lived in Italy for quite some time and have to say that the pizza at this restaurant is very much like the pizzas they make over there. They use the freshest ingredients, many of them flown in directly from Italy, and you can taste the difference. There are many good things to try on the menu, but I would recommend the insalata caprese with buffala mozzerela, arancini (rice balls filled with cheese) la margherita pizza D.O.C (this means the ingredients meet Italian standards of authenticity...make sure that's buffala mozzerella as well), the gnocchi, and most of their specials tend to be very good (ask your server). The house chianti is very good, and they have a great selection of other wines and beers. Many people may claim to have a better pizza in this city, and that's fine depending on how you like your pizza and what style is your preference, (I also like a good NY style pizza) but if you want an authentic Italian pizza, this is your place.

3YqYMpO6gKx3s59bEgZe0Q.text: OK, I must say that I do love their Pizza. The DOC Marg pizza is truly amazing. Also, the wine bar is quaint and the patio is a delight in the summer. However, the prices are so high for the food that I have stopped going. $17 for a indiviudal pizza? The wine selection also has gone down in quality and up in price. If you have money to burn, then head there for the Pizza and ambiance. Othwerwise let's hope they come to their senses about their pricing.

lC8jBE5XcDggx_HrYLJ0nA.text: We were seated in the wine bar area as the first customers for the evening. Two other tables were seated about 15 minutes after we placed our order. Started off nice. Excellent cocktails and appetizers. We ordered 2 pasta dishes, 1 pizza and 1 calzone. The 2 other tables that sat after us received both their appetizers and their entrees were delivered before ours.  Finally our pasta dishes arrived. Then about 5 mins later our pizza arrived.  During that delivery I informed our waitress that my pasta was too hard and she took it back to the kitchen. Finally the calzone arrived.  My husband and sons finished their meals and I had yet to receive my pasta.  When I finally received it, it was good but not worth $18 for a cup of pasta.  I doubt if we would ever go back based on the poor service from the kitchen.

0g_YUd-w6lM5QrAZLZAFpg.text: Great traditional pizzas - but don't complain that it isn't like Pizza Hut! The back room is amazing....

adyGTNVmlVtg3kgCOkZl-w.text: I have had two dining experiences there with extremely poor service. A restaurant at this price point must do better. I sent the following message to the managers and proprietor who could not be bothered to reply.    First let me say that I think that the food at Il Pizziaolo is outstanding. Everything is prepared perfectly. I enjoy the food so much that last night I decided to bring my mother there who is Cleveland Magazine's food Critic, Laura Taxel. The food was excellent as always but the service left much to be desired. When we arrived we were ushered to the overcrowded wine bar where the bartender was clearly overwhelmed. I had to give her my drink order three times and wait 20 minutes before we had a cocktail. When we were seated and ordered a bottle of wine we were told that the restaurant was out of wine glasses and we would have to wait for our bottle. We told the server, who did an excellent job under the circumstances,  that we would be happy to drink our wine out of table glasses but he never brought it out. Then when we got our appetizer which included a dip to be spread we were told that there was no bread. We were also offered olive oil for dipping but it was never brought out. We were almost done with the appetizer by the time the wine came out.  The most disappointing thing to me was that the manager never touched the table to apologize for running out of wine glasses and bread.   Furthermore this was the second time in a row that there were major service issues. The last time I dined there my wife and I ordered our appetizer, pizza, and entrees at the same time and all of the food was brought out at once.  We had to send the entrees back and the food was wasted.  This is one of  my wife and my favorite restaurants but to have two consecutive experiences with such poor service is very unfortunate. Thank you for your time.

b0No_SuYBDkl85gUUUPOPg.text: I'm not typically drawn to Italian food .. But as I'm eating my left overs today, I cannot wait to go back for dinner again. I've heard so much about this place, and wasn't sure what to expect but the food was just so good. As I walked in I was a little underwhelmed by the inside, but as you walk out the back door it opens up into a big beautiful patio. We sat on the patio and as it got dark the lights turned on and there was a huge tree with a vine right in the middle, and it was pretty magical.   They also have another building with a wine bar that you walk into from the patio with a comfy leather couch and additional seating and a small bar. The bar tender was very helpful in helping me try different Italian wines that I might enjoy.   Once we got our table on the patio, we ordered arancini's and meatballs as appetizers. Both were delicious. Then after much consideration I ordered the ravioli caprese and they were awesome. Our waitress was lovely and very helpful as well. Great experience!

mFRuqUcfML1Ka5r8vhqBvg.text: I can't even begin to tell you the disappointment I had after eating here. I've been a long time visitor of Il Pizzaiolo in Mt. Lebo. The server was amateur and quite frankly, disinterested. The food was average, at best. The portion sizes were absurdly small, and the cost was criminal. Back to the server (Chelsea)....never brought us bread, never refilled our water, never asked if we wanted sides, and clearly could have cared less. And not to mention, never told us upfront about the many items that they ran out of that evening. We only found out by asking and consequently having to study the menu and settle for third or fourth choices. That was my last visit.....best of luck with your great customer service & overpriced menu. #wherestheservice

-3nqhI13i3OJ5CeTSdkTmA.text: My husband and I went there for a date night. My husband got the personal Margherita pizza ($18), and I got the basic cheese ravioli with marinara sauce ($22). While the food was fresh and was made with quality ingredients, I don't think it justifies the price (This is not gourmet food by any means!). If you've never eaten homemade food, I can see why you'd be impressed. We liked the food okay, but felt ripped off, so it's very unlikely we'll go back.

dy5hMxs2LnHDr-qk489NfQ.text: My girlfriend and I were searching for the perfect place for dinner and drinks in the Mt Lebanon/Bridgeville area, and this restaurant immediately came to mind! Even on a Friday afternoon, we were still able to snag an 8:30 dinner reservation that evening for two. I was so excited to return after having such a nice lunch with my sister in law several months ago.  As it was a hectic Friday evening, service was initially a little slow. It took the hostess 5-10 minutes to seat us at our table, and our waitress was also MIA for a while when we were ready to order wine. However, I quickly forgave the minor delays when I took my waitress up on her dinner recommendation. We started with the Arancini, but really, you can't go wrong with fried rice balls. I did enjoy that there were two varieties that we were both able to try. I had planned to order the Cavatelli Rapini, but my waitress so passionately recommended the Cappelletti that I had to go with her recommendation. Wow, I am so happy that I did. The pasta had a beautiful smooth texture and fresh flavor while the mortadella, prosciutto, pork, and parmigiano-reggiano filling was hearty and robust and just simply divine. This tasty homemade concoction was topped with a rich and decadent tomato sauce.   I wished that I had room for more because the heavenly lemon dessert that I shared last time was amazing. However, I was just too full and will have to return yet again to try more on the menu.

RS2ZOO-0MnsESXNyifZweQ.text: Long wait, expensive drinks, pretty good salad but absolutely tasteless pizza. I can't even express how tasteless this pizza was. The pizza you can buy frozen from a box is 100x tastier and 1/4 the price.

KEPtZgPnp9tkNGJ9KmtWwg.text: I love Il Pizzaiolo and will definitely be back! Italian food is one of my favorites and I am always looking for places that do it authentically and that do it right! Il Pizzaiolo totally nailed it in my opinion!   While the dining area is on the small side and it did get pretty loud (keep this in mind because it could be an issue), the food was delicious.  From my wedding soup and veggie antipasti to my pasta pomodoro and cannoli, I was completely satisfied and enjoyed every bite. Only improvement could be that the wedding soup was slightly under salted. The pomodoro was perfectly seasoned and I could eat that cannoli every day! It actually had ricotta filling as it should!   Service was fast and friendly although our waiter did struggle a bit to remember our order. Very neat and clean. Regardless, it was a fantastic experience and I will absolutely be back for another delicious meal. Totally worth the price in my opinion!

9wOqqRqqDYxJERnYfHeBSA.text: We were asked if we wanted to be seated in the Wine Bar area, and said "sure, why not."  We didn't even realize this little area was there.  It was a bit chilly at first, but as soon as more people were seated, it got warmer.   We tried the fried meatballs and arancini as appetizers.  Both were delicious, and the marinara was delectable.  Quattro Formaggi pizza was excellent and just enough for two to share after eating appetizers.  We still splurged and shared a cannoli for dessert.  It had the perfect amount of cinnamon, and was not overly sweet.    I will definitely be visiting again! :)

EWuKyGF0GBuhSgmwhL78FA.text: Horrible restaurant. A complete rip off and the food was really bad. Cold and over priced for what you get. Do not go here!!!

yO91qiOWuNw50vh61qrIRw.text: Soooo super busy! Definitely expect to wait if you're coming for dinner. The store is very clean and service is outstanding. The food is delicious and it's sincerely authentic. Highly recommend

tVUo7QkWGyWZzCkX4PZURg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the area. Always get the charcuterie board. They have the best fresh mozzarella. I am a sucker for a good vodka sauce and theirs is amazing. Never had a bad meal here. Even the wood fired pizzas are good. Tip- ask to sit in the wine bar. The regular restaurant is noisy and crowded. The patio is nice but I'm Not an outdoor water. The wine bar is cozy. Not too many tables and you can sit in the couches in front of the bar while Waiting for your table with a glass of wine. Go to date experience.

Vr8HAhXGlj843KS3oY9TnQ.text: If you ask anyone who knows me what my favorite restaurant is... the answer would easily be Il Piz. The Mt. Lebo location will always be close to my heart, I love literally everything about it. In my opinion this is their best location!   I've been coming here for years and have tried just about everything on the menu at ll Piz- some of my favorites being the Marghertia D.O.C pizza, Panzarotti, Arancini, Insalata Caprese, Penne Alla Vodka, and of course their wide selection of wine. Their food is fresh and so simple that it melts in your mouth. It reminds me of food that you would eat while in Italy.   The restaurant atmosphere is amazing, and what's better than the court yard on a Summer day or the wine bar on a cold Winter night? The court yard is so cute, it is my mom and mine favorite thing to do in the summer! I also love the wine bar, it is the "hidden gem" of Il Piz, located in the building behind the restaurant. It is a cozy atmosphere with a small bar, fireplace, some couches, and a few tables to eat at. Their service is always amazing, I've never had a bad experience with a waiter here.   Il Piz has everything to offer for a True Italian girl like myself! Amazing atmosphere, Italian food, and wine!!

lBHyOBblE5t0jRtXe92S2Q.text: I wanted to like this place because it had such great reviews and I love wood fired oven/Neapolitan pizza.  But, unfortunately, we were disappointed.  First of all, I just don't understand the design.  I think they are trying to go for a rustic look with the tables that look worn out, but it just looks out of place.  For the menu prices I had higher expectations for how things would look on the inside.  Also, this place is super small and if it's just two of you, expect to be placed at a tiny table.    On to the food.  We had a burrata appetizer special and shared a pizza.  The burrata itself was so good (how could you go wrong with burrata) but its presentation alongside thick slices of undressed tomato and whole basil leaves was strange.  At other wood fires pizza places we have had burrata (priced over $10 cheaper, but I will admit the quality of the burrata itself not as good) which they serve with dressed greens and bread toasted in the wood fired oven.  That's the way to do it - toasted bread is key!  They give everyone a bread basket but the appetizer itself should have been served with bread fresh out of the wood fire oven in my opinion - it would have helped to elevate the burrata even more.  But I did appreciate not having the extra calories and I do love tomatoes.  I still felt like something was missing.   The pizza we shared was the mushroom and it was really disappointing.  The crust was too thick.  We have been to several wood fire oven/Neapolitan  pizza places in a couple different states and one thing they usually all have in common is a thinner crust which I prefer.  I found the pizza to be average in taste too.  :( sad.....and expensive which would have been fine if everything was on point.

AmRaaec9YSw-Tsizz0lejw.text: We've eaten here twice.  Both times we ordered pizza and celebrated with a couple of glasses of wine.  The pizza was always really good.    My only complaint is that it can be difficult to get a table since the place is so small.

pzeFW32xBVhmxcbdvdrgEw.text: The closest you'll get to authentic Italian pizza in Pittsburgh. Their pasta dishes are also great. I prefer the Mt. Lebo location but downtown is convenient and beautiful as well.

1kz88fktyoivFD-4G_UdLQ.text: Tried the pizza. Good but crust was burnt. Definitely not worth $19 for a pizza. Would do Fiori's next time for 1/3 the price. You will also pay the same price there for a drink as you do in Miami lol

2qHhmkQHrqPqoQ49_pqxgA.text: I used to love Pizzaiolo.  Go for a pizza, eat the pizza, pay, and leave.  Now, it seems like while the pizza is still great, they're trying to go for something that they shouldn't be.  I've never been totally pleased with anything on the menu besides the pizza, other than the pasta bolognese, and now they don't even slice the pies for you.  "Oh, well, in Italy, they don't slice the pizza because they don't want the crust to get soggy."  That's all well and good, but I'm not in Italia right now.  I'm in Mt. Lebanon, and would like my pizza to come sliced.  And by the way, the crust gets soggy even before you slice it yourself, which never used to happen before.  Not worth the money anymore, and that's unfortunate.  As an Italian girl, I would trade Il Pizzaiolo for Little Tokyo any day anymore.

LQ9a0S6xMZmKKU-iV0TDcA.text: This is hands down one of the best Italian restaurants in the Pittsburgh area. There isn't a bad item on the menu and its all high quality. The atmosphere is casual, the wine flows freely and the food is excellent. I've had lots of Pittsburghers claim its expensive and "not enough for the price" but that's just a mindset that must change here. This isn't Eat N Park or Joe Schmoe Italian. It's worth what you pay, especially for the pizzas and the branzino entree. Having grown up in North Jersey, I've been around good Italian my whole life--and this is good Italian. Worth visiting, worth waiting, worth every penny. The wine bar, while tight, has a cool vibe--It gets very busy on weekends...They also don't take reservations at Lebanon locale, but it's always full on weekends, so I can understand why they don't--There's always someone willing to wait....During the nicer months, its fun to eat outside on their back patio. Get some wine, grab a Peroni, kick back and enjoy.

FyIQF15-ck4WnAen8jqRqw.text: Editing my review to say that it is not "good for kids" as yelp indicates. They have high chairs but no changing tables in the bathrooms. When I asked a hostess about a changing table, she suggested I change my baby on the dirty bathroom floor. That might have just been the one hostess because when I told them there was no way I would put my baby on the dirty bathroom floor to change her, they offered a couch in the bar area to change her on. Also when we were seated, they took us to the very noisy wine bar out back and wanted us to leave our stroller on a different floor. Sorry but we're not leaving our expensive stroller and car seat where we can't even see it. We ended up having to carry the stroller up the stairs and into the back room of the wine bar. Very disappointing because as the rest of my review shows, I love their food and I would love to go back but every time I think of going, I hesitate because of how we were treated last time we went. NOT kid friendly.   Great Italian food! The homemade pasta was so good! My in-laws have Sicilian heritage and the arancini is some of the best they've ever had. We love coming here for the gnocchi, the linguine alla vongole, and the desserts of course. They have a great valpolicella that we always get, but I'm sure their other wines are excellent as well. The ambiance is very cozy too, you feel like you're in Italy. Definitely worth going to this restaurant!

CX5qTs5MzMxeSIM5iPYdhQ.text: So I'd had friends talk about this place ever since I'd moved here 3 years ago, but I hadn't gotten around to trying it yet. I lived in Philly for a long time which meant lots of excellent Italian food.  I've had some bad experiences here, so I don't exactly believe people when they tell me a place is great.  Boy was I wrong!  I loved every single dish I had here.  From the perfectly dressed Caesar salad to the magnificent pasta (mine had broccoli rabe and sausage) to the best freaking pizza I've had since moving here.  It was the middle of my work day, but I browsed the wine menu and it was lovely...not to mention the variety of dessert cordials available!  I LOVED it. The location is kind of random for me since I live on the East End, but it was good enough to always be worth a visit when I'm nearby!

7wKXnTchoL8_Qgt3FOV8Jw.text: Not bad, but not terribly good for the price.   Service and wine selection were both great, just wasn't impressed with the flavors.   For my money, Papa J's or Piccolo Forno.

IJkKNCH_W8H4pkl8p-vbmw.text: If you are able to sit outside, or in the main dining area, it is a comfortable and warm environment to have delicious verde gnocchi (smaller portion and very filling) or eggplant lasagna ( huge portion & very filling ).   My boyfriend and I went during the busy dinner time ( a little after 6pm) and were greeted and told we could sit at the wine bar for quicker seating. We followed the waitress past the traditional dining area in the front and past the cooking/ dish area to get to the stairs for the wine bar seating. It was much darker inside and somewhat noisy (as a bar typical would be with a TV and dim lights) , but the food is ALWAYS worth the wait.    Overall, 5 star meal. 4 stars only for the walk to get from dining area #1 to #2 .

eEmM7wvabSYJG6_5Y-Nbcw.text: Great service and delicious food! Also, very dog friendly! We brought our dog and were seated on the lovely outdoor patio. They brought our dog water and even a meatball!

Ox9Zi6PKWxVuxLsLZuRDmA.text: Have been here multiple times over the past few years. Amazing food...great service and the wine annex is the bomb. Highly recommend and a great date spot or place to entertain people visiting from out of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9AYQlHy9mZbh4dd9EoGd1g.text: Awesome  place.  Pizza is very very good and if you didn't know certified Neapolitan style pizza (look up what that means).    I also had the wedding soup and  I've tried them everywhere and was by far the best I've ever had.    I've heard there can be a long wait but we went the saturday before Easter and had a party of 6 but didn't have much of a wait.  If you do have to wait, there is a quaint little wine bar in the back (also has liquor and some bottled beer).  Would definitely go back again.

_A7Gz3tWy-DNp48SUHn_DQ.text: Excellent service!  Waitress is friendly and personable.  Clean and nice interior.  Pizza reminded me of authentic pizza from Italy.  Atmosphere is friendly and casual.  Kids will enjoy and adults too!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 4 Cheese pizza was delicious!

gMdX7GyclWgmfrMOWz6qzQ.text: Definitely a top 5 dining experience that I've had in Pittsburgh. Food was incredible, ambiance is on point and the service is second to none. I highly recommend skipping the main dining area, and going behind the restaurant to where they have hidden away, a delightful bar bungalow, complete with fireplace and casual seating. Such an amazing dining experience, and Sarah, the bartender was the star of the entire evening. If I was opening a new restaurant, I would write her a blank check in hopes that she would bring her talents to my establishment.

t3VAqJKw_uXmJOBjvfYVuw.text: Great place, relaxed ambience at the wine bar. Exceptional service and the same for the meals.

UWNXyraiIg4s--MhJlEXIQ.text: My wife and I stopped here on a recent visit to Pgh. Whenever we are in town I always look for a local, non-chain, Italian restaurant. We were not disappointed. The atmosphere was local neighborhood family restaurant. But the menu made me look around to see if we had been transported to Chicgo. The wine list was outstanding with a great variety of Italian vintages by the glass and bottle. We were pressed for time so ordered pizza while reluctantly passing on the longer to prepare Lasagna or Eggplant. All of their foods are prepared from ingredients imported from Italy. The Mahrgarita (sp) pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms was wonderful! As was the Super Tuscan wine. We will be back when we have more time to further explore the menu.

WBrGvcKaOt7bj2YETiYmxQ.text: Used to frequent this place when it first opened years ago....when it was simple, delicious, byob and reasonably priced. Food remains ok but prices have more than doubled. I don't return on principle. There is just as good, and far better...pizza available many other places. Good place for the locals to walk to, cozy outdoor dining and wine bar, otherwise, look elsewhere! Their Market Square location worse.

JvowMrxIYQuFRwlpV5dbKw.text: Pasta is my second language. Eating pasta is my sport!   With that said, I'm always hesitant to get gnocchi because it never seems to be cooked right. It's always gummy and gross. But the waitress assured me the gnocchi here was homemade and very delicious. I took her advice and was served an incredible plate of melt in your mouth light and puffy clouds of Italian magic! Need I say more? Ok I will....   The sauce also tasted delicious and definitely homemade. I was torn between getting the gnocchi or pasta vodka. I would have been totally satisfied with that choice as well. Thankfully, my friend ordered the pasta vodka and I ws able to steal away a couple bites of it. The sauce was fantastic! It was so creamy and had a hint of Parmesan cheese flavor. Cheese makes EVERYTHING better in my eyes (and mouth)!   Our server was really fantastic and did a great job with input on our meals and also filling us in on some upcoming events. They're having cooking classes and wine pairing nights, which I'm totally into! Such a great way to get people in the door and eating, plus drinking!   Very quaint and cute inside. I went there Thursday and had to hold myself back from not going there again on Saturday.  My pasta loving self will sure to be back soon though!

zNoIeEoyA9SbLykJoG8uQA.text: This was the first time I has been and I went to this restaurant and we went because of a recommendation. Absolutely spot on. I got the margarita pizza which was great except I could use more basil. My husband got the eggplant Parmesan which was by far the best of ever had. Even though we were full we tried two desserts that were apparently made fresh every day by the pastry chef. I got the term is Sue which was excellent except a bit too much Cocoa. He got the limoncello cake which was outstanding. Keep up the good work we'll be back!

Nt5lUo1Fm20Gh4z2sFRR-g.text: During the ordering process today with server Adam, he, my wife and I concluded that we would visit often and start at the top of the menu and order in sequence (not all in the same day) until we cover everything on the menu.  Everything is so good that there could be no disappointments.  You think that is crazy? Not really. I have never been in a restaurant where I could comfortably pick anything on the menu and not regret my choice. You can do that at Il Pizzaiolo!  Before we attack the menu from top-to-bottom, you need to get there quick. The experience is awesome. The food is even better!

O5eKAwWBTQMIQK42Ul1OCQ.text: I don't make it out to the suburbs often, always assuming the best food was in the city, but Il Pizzaiolo has proven me wrong. I went last Saturday, and although there was a bit of a wait, it is easy to wait when you have a good glass of wine in your hand.  I wish I remembered the name of the appetizer - it was on special and was like caprese but the cheese was more "buttery." I didn't really know what they meant by that when they described it, but after trying it I can say that is a great description. It was delicious. I tried the Prosciutto pizza which was a perfectly baked, authentic Neapolitan pizza. The dough was seasoned well with a sweetness to it that I loved. I also tried the Pollo alla Piccata which was also very good.  All in all, I was very happy with my experience there.

JrmESJK3PrU2Zj6DBKQmkg.text: Ordered take out lasagna for Valentines Day, it was the worst lasagna we've ever had. Stouffers frozen would be a step up. Hated to do but called and complained and they refunded on our bank card. I'm giving it 2 stars because the hostess was nice and the Caesar salad was good. But this is in no way the "best Italian food in Pittsburgh" or anywhere else. $21 per person and we had to complain, it was noodles with a spoonful of mozzarella and tasteless sauce, nothing in between. Complete disappointment, next time we will go back to Bistro 19 which is always great and consistent.

JDBB8ik74X2Dcn2h9Vy4UA.text: Highly recommended. We ate in the "wine bar", which is fun but quite noisy and crowded. Not recommended for a romantic date, but for a fun date it is good.  The food is quite good. Very good pizza and lasagna. And the wine selection is good as well.   It lost a star for its wine pricing, however. $55 for a bottle available at the local store for under $20 is a bit much. I understand this is normal pricing, and I have no problem with it if the wine is not normally available. But I feel it should be a little cheaper when you can

GMjnaWuKadpjNtuRojO9mA.text: Just not what I expected. Pizza was weak. Under baked.  Sauce was lacking.  Crust was way to soft.  And service could of been better. $500.00 bill says it all. Meatballs were good and warm bread was good. Light and crispy like the pizza crust SHOULD of been. Over priced for the quality.  Mediocre.  Slanted outside table made relaxing uncomfortable.

hRrHhiwMYOZjqbsC0pZWzQ.text: Alright, so I had a mixed experience at II Pizzaiolo. We went here while visiting Pittsburgh to celebrate a birthday.  The restaurant is small, seating is quite close together, and noise level is probably a little high to carry on a meaningful conversation without your table neighbor overhearing all the details.  I think we may have been a bit under dressed. I would say "snappy casual" would have appropriate. We were not looking quite that snappy.  Anyway, we ordered an antipasta platter with cured meat, cheese, olives, fava bean spread, and some roasted veggies. Pair that with an excellent bottle of red wine. It was amazing! Surely enough food there for both of us to eat for dinner but we wanted to try the pizza.  Unfortunately, less than 10 min after our huge appetizer came out our server delivered the pizza to our tiny table where there wasn't any more room and we were clearly not ready for the next part of our meal. So, we let the pizza sit there.  When we got ready to eat the pizza it was cold and the crust was rubbery. When our server returned we explained the trouble with the pizza and he promptly got us a fresh one. This was a very nice gesture and promptly rectified the fact he never should have delivered the first one when he did.  The crust on the second pizza was still rubbery. The platter and wine were by far the best part of the meal. Overall the evening was enjoyable but I don't think I would order the pizza again.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

AdVmKnfypLFCdzwuY-03XQ.text: Very good Italian good. It was loud and busy on Saturday night. A little pricey but I don't mind paying extra for good food like this. Get the tiramisu (very large portion) or canoli for dessert both were very good. We were not disappointed with the main entrees or appetizers and the service was very professional.

NIleM_mZddtY7Oh3TkMmvg.text: The bar in the back is gorgeous. Drinks are better than their food. My pizza was okay, nothing yummy. Way too over priced. Go for drinks and nothing more.

h_uKXsMDiZHpY5YkljG_gg.text: The wine bar in the back is one of my favorite drink spots of all time. We just visited in January, and the fireplace was going. Perfect and cozy! Good place for a conversation, but very tiny. Good for a date or catching up with a friend. It's an older and mature crowd, but because of the way it's kind of tucked away, you'll seem like you really know something if you bring a date here.  There are a good number of wines by the glass, and some good cocktails. Try the Bufala Negra (bourbon, balsamic vinegar, ginger ale, and some other ingredients I can't remember).   Drinks aren't cheap, but these drinks are for sipping anyway. The bartender was sweet, too.

NAw-iY0jcTLqDTzRNGydmQ.text: First let me start by saying how overpriced the food is here! I got the lasagna and it was awful and cold. My friend got the margarita pizza and said it was okay at best. Not worth the time or money.

eDrjlND7n6J-7-infVlR-Q.text: While the food here is pretty good Italian fare, it just doesn't justify the price. I found it difficult to pay $22 for ravioli. Yes, ravioli. It's difficult to find even the simplest dish for under $20. Going as a group of four, only half of us liked our meals. Everything at this particular restaurant is overpriced. When I looked at the wine list, traditional wines that I would normally order at another restaurant was about 25-40% more, so I stuck with water.  The waiting staff is excellent and know exactly what they're talking about. The ambience is also very nice. At the end of the day though, two meals without any sides, drinks, or any extras cost a whopping $54. The portions were also generally small. It's a place I'd maybe go to again for a special occasion, but there are definitely better Italian restaurants with much better prices.

NSUCBCOZ1vlBN9po5jq68w.text: The bad first.   Its a little pricey as has already been mentioned. Parking is a minor annoyance. But what really bothered me was the noise level. Sound just bounces off the hard walls and makes it very difficult to have a conversation.   But once you taste the pizza none of it matters. The crust is a tiny bit soggy and it doesnt detract from it even a little. The sauce. That sauce. Simple.  Fresh. Mind blowingly delicious as pizza is meant to be. As close to a real deal New York old school pizza as it gets. Dont spoil it with too many toppings. Just try a simple Margherita and see what the fuss is about.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The real deal.
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The reason to eat here....stunningly good pizza.
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizers. Insalata caprese and Misto Antipasta. Both are delicious.

Ny2OxWI9wIbr_e1xY5rtAw.text: I have been here a few times, and I am always pleased with the food. My most recent visit I got the pizzuvio pizza which was basically crafted by angels. It's half calzone half margherita pizza and it was killer.  I also got the wedding soup, and that was equally as delicious but that pizza really tied that visit with a delicious little bow. No drinks this time, but the wine selection is great.  It can get a little crowded, so I would try to plan your trip in advance. My husband and I went at like 3 on a Saturday, and we didn't have a wait but people started really coming in as we were leaving around 4ish.

3_h7bd2rf2dX5fJok1b-cA.text: Il Pizzaiolo is my new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. We came in without a reservation on a Saturday night and we're still seated immediately. First, they brought out a large jug of water and glasses along with toasted bread and oil. I ordered the caprese salad, and the tomatoes and mozzarella both tasted extraordinarily fresh. The tomatoes truly tasted like they were freshly picked out of a garden. I also had the margharita pizza and the penne rosa pasta. Both were absolutely outstanding - and vegetarian! The portion sizes were perfect, at the end of my three course dinner I was perfectly stuffed. Overall the food was spectacular, the service was fast and polite, and the location is perfect for an evening date. I will absolutely return soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6QEvcF8-IlaC1sjBPN2BIA.text: This restaurant intentionally circulates inaccurate prices on the internet. All real prices are much higher than advertised.  If you choose to go, know that the cheapest plate of pasta is $19 and a cup of soup is $8.
