gFHrB2UtZWIXCJXyQrnBDw.text: Food still good.  Service poor.  Been using this as a go-to for quite a while.   Too bad

-oLsK2lgIU7Oq6dqa4uoYg.text: One of the best meals we've had in a long time!!!!!  Even tho it's only about 5 minutes from our house, for some reason it's been years since we've been.  After tonight's meal, it will definitely not be that long again.   Started off with the anti pasta plate that was so delish that we could have had one for each of us!   White bean dip, peppers, olives, cheese, pepperoni.   For entrees, hubs had the Ragu.  I think he's going to dream about it! I had a few bites and it was soooo scrumptious!   I had the cheese ravioli.  I normally would not order something like that, but the description of it with it being filled with mozzarella made me want to order it.   It was not a wrong decision - they were yummy with the perfect amount (read not a lot) of sauce.  The raviolis were the star, not swimming in sauce.   We were full so got dessert to go ~ cannelloni and a lemon cake.   They look good ... haven't eaten them yet.   To top off the terrific meal was amazing service by Jess.    Believe me, it will be a few weeks and we will return ~ not years!!

q-VA6u2u-lGMJmpkX6Ycow.text: I always order the pasta bolognese ragu. Highest rating. Service was excellent and great relaxed neighborhood restaurant atmosphere. Will return here whenever I am in town. Have since tried their caprese salad, lemon spongecake dessert, and cafe latte. Everything is top-notch and this has become possibly my favorite restaurant.

LMSkz_XB4FlrSlC1WImnQA.text: Consistently very, very good. Attentive service, delicious food -- both the pizza and "secondo" dishes -- nice wine list. Extra points for being open Mondays at lunchtime.

-b0c8A1O5MavIB_Rqpra3g.text: Expensive but worth it as long as someone else is paying for it. The ambiance is relaxing and romantic. The waitstaff is very meticulous as well.

hMJFuPlLA0YDCSP4dlIWsw.text: Had a reservation for a Saturday night and was seated in the wine bar in the back which I thought had a much cooler ambiance than the main dining area. I ordered gnocchi with a blush type of sauce (wasn't on the menu exactly but I just asked for it), it came out decently fast and it was delicious! Portion looked small for the price ($21!!) but I guess gnocchi is super filling so it was okay. Waiter was polite and patient with our large crowd. I would come back if I had a craving for gnocchi, it is a little pricey but that's expected for an Italian restaurant. Overall good food and a cool ambiance!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi with a creamy blush type sauce (wasn&#39;t on the menu, I asked for vodka sauce)

O5xKFwDrvbskmcXODOXW2Q.text: My wife and I were given a 38th wedding anniversary gift from our son who decided he would give us the gift of a nice dinner out , he called the restaurant and had them charge what ever we wanted to his card , such a good hearted you man we raised, any way we show up at the restaurant nice little place in the heart of Mt Lebanon, we were greeted at the door by a very pleasant young lady who immediately seated us , a small table right next to the front windows , great seats , able to watch all the crazy going by, Deek a very nice and knowledgeable young man comes over and asks if we would like to put in a drink order and if we would like water , my wife got a glass of wine and I got a beer , he was back with the drinks and a large bottle of water in just minutes, he took our order and since they have a wood fired pizza oven it's silly not to order a margarita pizza as a starter, and then my wife ordered spaghetti with a side of 3 meatballs, I ordered a pasta dish with a fennel sausage in it , (I'll post the name of the dish as soon as I remember it ) , anyway the pizza was with out a doubt one of the best I have ever eaten and I make a hell of a good pizza myself, the sauce very nice not too sweet and you can taste the tomato in it , fresh mozzarella and basil, the crust was so tender it just melted in your mouth , are main course came and nice size portions and 3 large meatballs, I could tell as soon as I took the first bite that the past was fresh made perfectly cooked, the sausage was delicious ahh the fennel in it was just great , wife said she loved the sauce on her spaghetti and the meatballs were tender and very moist, all in all one of the top 10 dinners we have had out in 38 years of marriage, I do know we will definitely return, if you try this place do yourself a favor and definitely order a pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TNno5W7o3VXPAvaQR3nTLQ.text: There is no service included in your experience here. I wanted some fresh pepper for my caesar salad, but there was no one available to ask. Random servers drop your food and run off. We were sharing a chicken dish, the plate was dropped in the middle of the table. No one asked if we needed some plates, the server never stopped by to offer plates. Checking in to see how things are going is not done. Dirty dishes and empty glasses were never cleared. Asking if you'd like another round of drinks is not included. You have to flag the server down and then your wine never comes. We had to share a knife throughout the meal, even though we asked for a replacement. When a restaurant is charging a premium, you expect premium service, not worse than you get at Olive Garden.   The pizza is not that great. One piece of basil on an entire margarita pizza is ridiculous. The crust was thick and doughy, not thin and crispy as you would expect from a wood-fired pizza.   The manager is completely clueless and only served to make our experience worse, rather than better. We were refused dessert and left feeling sufficiently punished for voicing our feelings about the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No one is interested in clearing dishes, offering beverages or serving dessert here.

fvbxXKJ5MvHvCGSqDgVyqw.text: Really nice atmosphere. Chic but comfortable interiors and my waitress was awesome. Food was good too. I loved the overall experience.   However, the food is very expensive. I thought I could share a $22 pasta but it was so tiny!!!! Only come here if you want to splurge for the night, sharing, or celebrating cause the prices are high.  Overall, I recommend but watch the prices!

rYbLTVO5pQSRnutSxVavDA.text: Do not recommend booking a large party. Our reservations for a party of about 20 were double booked. While they made other accommodations for us to open the wine room to only our party, we arrived to a populated wine room. We were told it should be cleared out soon; However, we waited over an hour and a half for it to be almost cleared out. Considering we have parents in our party with sitters back home, waiting any longer for a reserved space wasn't ideal for our party nor should it be appropriate for anyone with well-planned reservations. We left.  The bartender during this ordeal was impolite while we were waiting. Management was defensive blaming our party for not being willing to wait any longer.

-bphB3_wm8ywcsftc8IO2A.text: What a great time! They have a fantastic outdoor patio in the back that is beautiful. Homemade pastas and great wine selection!!  We haven't been here in a while - normally we'd get a wood fired delicious pizza but we went for the homemade pastas instead.  Gnocchis were fluffy delightful clouds - delicious!!!  Standout was the homemade cavitellis with the sweet fennel sausage meatballs - WOW!!  So good.  Our waitress was attentive and absolutely adorable!  Too full for dessert but we'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Homemade cavatelli with sweet fennel sausage
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar side salad with white anchovies

SytWz74_rJEQAr3qlIV-fg.text: I found this restaurant featured on the Top Restaurants in Pittsburgh 2016 and figured I should give it a go!  Let me start by saying if you are going to eat here, sit outside. The patio has a cozy, romantic feel with brick floors and trees with lights through out them. It is a perfect place for a date night.   My boyfriend started out with a golden monkey and I ordered a peach bellini. My drink was ordinary- nothing to rave about or get again, but not terrible.   The bread and oil beforehand was alright. The bread seemed like it was not made in house and we were not given more than a tablespoon of plain dipping oil for two people. I would have liked to have seen homemade bread and oil with spices and/or vinegar in it.   We forewent an appetizer (which was a mistake since our food took a little bit to come out) and decided upon the salsiccia e rapini pizza and pollo marsala. The pizza came out blazing out. When we were finally able to try it, we both agreed that it was flavorful yet we have had better pizza elsewhere. The pollo marsala on the other hand was out of this world amazing. It was be difficult to come back and not get this every single time.   The reason for the star deduction was due to three  things. The service was suboptimal- our waitress was not very present and seemed to be spending a lot of time at tables near us instead. I was also disappointed in the experience as a whole due to the positive reviews I have read. Lastly, it was a bit pricey- one round of drinks was over $20 and the (small) pizza was $19.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Marsala and Peach Bellini on the back patio area.

9cRl7PikXaV_yHkcWZH6LQ.text: I got a margherita pizza here and it was very, very good. Perfect crust, fresh sauce and delicious mozzarella and basil. Will definitely be back!

9-VE57Vq49ipuPZAKedgDQ.text: Not a huge menu in terms of variety, but excellent service. Freshest and most authentic Italian food in the south hills!

aS75D2nojzWGGQG7qBywxQ.text: After many years of being a frequent customer, I suggested to a friend to meet for a late dinner. Just beforehand I Reviewed the menu on line and was shocked to find the price increase from 10 yrs prior when i visited as a a family often. $19.00 for gnocchi? Unbelievable! I suggested another place but my friend said to keep with the plan. We decided to split a pizza. Then found to our dissatisfaction that the pizza was only 10". We ordered one each but again...$17 for a pizza? This was a place enjoyable and reasonable for A family of four. .no more. What was worse was the pizza was just average. I am in the food business and find it so dissapointing to to feel taken when all i wanted was a good meal for a fair price. Let's not go into the underfilled $10 glass of wine.

GsIiTz3X1yoXU3UP_0rINw.text: I only enjoy eating and drinking in the upstairs wine bar.  The downstairs doesn't suit me.  Great atmosphere up in the wine bar.  The pizza and rice balls are my food of choice.  Bottle of wine, double espresso w/ a shot of sambuca...good start to an evening.

I-72L4dg4HowLBAfIdR0FA.text: I almost don't want to give the secret away.   Best italian food I have had since going to Italy.  Simple, yet addicting. The wine bar is hidden in the back area and it is such a nice place to visit during the week.  Don't even try to go there on the weekends... too crowded. In the summer, sitting outside is such a luxury.  Order the Rigatoni alla Siciliana.  Perfecto!

U3sAGxABraB-BaA5G5p9kw.text: Great little place in downtown Mt Lebanon. My mother and aunt live in Mt. Lebanon and my husband and I visit a couple times a year, and on a night we had to ourselves decided to have a late dinner here.As it was a Saturday, the place was packed and had a couple groups waiting. Because we were only needing a table for 2 we were able to get seated promptly.  This was one of the evenings when the daytime temperature was over 100 degrees and was still very hot after sundown; the restaurant was boiling hot. They have a wood burning pizza oven so I am sure that they cannot keep the place as cool as some eateries (most are too cold for me). Service was very fast and very attentive, and very nice. We had cold water on our table in under 30 seconds of seating, were given just the right amount of time to look at the menu, and received our appetizer within 10 minutes of seating. Our food arrived about 20 minutes after ordering, with enough time to not be rushed through our appetizer.  I cannot remember what our appetizer's name was, but it was a dough pocket filled with mozzarella and had yellow and red tomatoes to the side. It was well done, but I felt like it was simply too huge a portion to really be an appetizer/salad. Giant mound of mozzarella + only 4 thin slices of tomatoes seemed off somehow; still tasted great though. My husband had Linguini alle Vongole- clams in a white sauce. He absolutely loved the meal, and the dish arrived with more clams than I would ever have expected.  I ordered Chicken Piccata, as I was wanting something lighter than pasta or anything packed with cheese. The lemon was so refreshing and the sauce done very nicely- not too buttery, with more of the lemon and wine coming through- definitely nice after such a seething hot day. The quality of the food shines through, even from the menu. I appreciate a place that used San Marzano tomatoes, real buffalo mozzarella, huge sprigs of basil, , etc. The prices were a little steep but I didn't leave the place lamenting over the cost. The last comment I will leave is that the place is ungodly loud when full. Now, I am not a local, and I have always noticed that in general Pittsburgh restaurants are much louder than what I am used to (San Fransisco CA, Louisville KY, Washington DC, Baltimore MD and Philly). I usually chalk it up to a Pittsburgh thing, but this place was wayyyy louder for whatever reason. There was one group of maybe 10 (noise wasn't so much from them anyway) people but otherwise all small groups. I say this merely b/c a couple people have said it's a great date spot. I would agree, but NOT FOR A FIRST or any getting-to-know-you dates- you won't hear half of what your date said and who wants to have to scream so everyone around you knows it's a first date? :)  Overall, a great restaurant and I cannot wait to come back try their DOC pizza- it looked superb.

HaQ2K1cSrYfCeil0Pt1wGw.text: No need to fly to Naples when you can simply go to Mount Lebanon. The Margarherita pizza is as authentic as ones you find on Spannaconapoli with homemade pastas that are no slouches either.

mMue004jFp6Mkz2-DAed5A.text: WTF?  How does this place get so highly rated on Yelp?  It's not awful, but it was one of the most mediocre brick-oven pizzas I've ever eaten.  There's much better "fancy" pizza in Pittsburgh, and much better regular pizza, too.    The antipasto plate was good, but definitely not worth the $15 they charge for it.  Decor's not bad, but the space is a little noisy; service was pretty average, below what I'd expect for a $15/person place.    Long story short: unless you're in the neighborhood, you can get better Italian elsewhere in the 'burgh.  P.S. This is yet another Pittsburgh establishment that doesn't take credit cards.  Seriously, is the whole city in a 1995 time warp?  (...Or are all of these places just cheating on their tax bills?  It's a lot harder to hide check and credit card transactions from an auditor.  With cash, you just need to hide a few receipts.)

IJiewlGl9_i3Q2z8Nvchsw.text: My friends and I hadn't been here in a while and were surprised at how much higher the prices were. Everything is overpriced. Several of our pasta dishes were $21 each, and salad wasn't even included! The dishes were good but nothing great, and definitely not worth the ridiculous pricing. We had to wait an interminably long time for our food.

WKNs5YpPyGm4Ui1dHPPdbg.text: What a delight! Food was fabulous, service was good and perfectly timed. A bit on the pricy side, but definitely worth it. We'll definitely go back.

Pp_J5FfOCYE8GhHANH0uEg.text: I love the food here, and the pizza is outstanding. However, I've been coming here for years now and was slightly annoyed that they have reduced the size of their pizzas.  We used to get 6 slices and now you get 4, so needless to say it is slightly pricey, but excellent none the less. They're still my favorite pizza in the city, but will not visit as often.

dnP-zzQuIgmBgjTjT-CgGg.text: I have always held this place in high regard, super cute and has always been delicious but when my bf and I and a couple friends went a couple weeks ago I was extremely disappointed. I'm vegan and so is my bf so we were already limited in choices, the Napoli antipasto is awesome but our entree left much to be desired. I forget the exact name but it was basically a spaghetti w pomodoro sauce. I can't believe they charge $16 for this dish! It was cold and not a good portion. I got a huge hot pepper that burnt the crap out of my lip. I love spicy stuff too! Just not a good value for the $. I just moved back from nyc and my fav place there charges significantly less for significantly more. I'm so disappointed bc this was one of my go to places in Pgh! :/

52nZegJ1rak0Qjuqdm4mMg.text: Il piz, is a Mt lebo staple, but not that great.  We ordered the bucatini americano and a pizza.  The bucatini was good, but not a great value.  I was excited about the pizza because they cook it in a brick oven, which should make a great pie, but was disappointed when it came out soggy.  Should have been nice and crisp.  There weren't even many toppings to make it soggy.  probably give it another shot but not my first choice considering the prices.

3uUClHFuLXPEIwPlT2GNCA.text: Delicious, up scale pizza. Not a good place for young kids. Lovely patio.

hJwwvrLcGrCyfQS6bsSzjw.text: Best margherita I've had since eating at El Presidente in Napoli, Campagna

G-pmYPUCSgSXU0Z-f_cB1w.text: The most delicious pizza and the best cocktails in the area!! Such friendly staff!! I've always had an amazing experience!!

yUK7tKy8nUzkASudbDpW0Q.text: The BEST pizza. Pizza that while eating makes you feel like you're in another country. The first bite was absurdly amazing...I wasn't expecting my taste buds to explode with delight. And the rest of the bites until the pizza was done were equally happy. The flavor of the pizza is completely different than any of our chains and independent pizza places (whose pizza I also love...this pizza is just different). I would recommend getting the pizzas with their sauce because some of the pizzas on the menu don't come with sauce and their sauce is probably what makes the pizza so good. I mean, the crust is special and the topping ingredients are fresher & a better quality than other pizza places...but the sauce has all the flavor.   The other food we had was good, but it pales in comparison. I had the mistacanza (spelling i'm not so sure on) salad, which was just ok (I would skip it next time). My boyfriend ordered one of the paninis which was pretty large & had a lot of meat and cheese, but I doubt it was nearly as good as the pizza (the pizza was finished, half the panini went home). The menu had a lot of homemade pastas, which we didn't try but are probably great. The other standout part of our meal was the complimentary bread & olive oil served at the start...the olive oil was fantastic tasting, much better than any other restaurant I've been to in the past few years and one of the breads (it was buttery & had coarse salt on the top) was delicious.   The only warning I have is they are quite finicky about changing their dishes. The bottom of the menu does say "please no substitutions" but they really mean it...as in we asked to have sauce added to our pizza (an easy & normal request at most places) and the waitress actually had to go ask the chef if it would be ok because they reallllly don't like to change their dishes. So if you have kids or picky eaters with you, beware that you might not get your way.

q0mpULV3zV3AnCHMYY2ssQ.text: This is simply my favorite restaurant of any type, but it's Italian at its best. No Joke. It's rare to find a True D.O.C. certified pizza but they've taken all the steps to make it happen. Everything else I've tried on the well-rounded (but not too long) menu is terrific as well. Very focused wine list--all Italian and perfectly matched to the food. My only complaint is that the place is so popular now that it can be very crowded at peak hours and loud in the main room. I've never had to wait very long for a seat, but sometimes there is a wait. Try to hit it in the mid-afternoon for a more quiet experience. And definitely stick your head in the upstairs wine bar even if you're not eating there. It's such a cosy place you won't want to leave.

xGq7PS24EE_kXzSpvZ3Vxg.text: Tucked in a corner table in their wine/back house location was cozy given the rain pour happening outside. I ordered a chianti to start and then we ordered the vegetable app dish to share, which were both good. For my main meal I ordered the margherita DOC pizza based on the reviews. Delicious, fresh flavors though my pizza was a bit soggy which was a bit of a downer given the raves. However I would be interested in coming back and making sure that wasn't an anomaly.

FMDiuNfMMBgwDY-YPraaHQ.text: Heard  GREAT things about this place.  What a let down it was.  Made reservations for our Anniversary and showed up on time.  Early evening on a Friday night. We ordered the ravioli and a personal pizza.......it took 47 MINUTES for our food to come out !!!    I was counting. Because it was rediculous. The restaraunt was half empty, and we sat there for 47 minutes with a little bread and oil--wich they refilled twice because the food was taking so long.  AND NEVER refilled our empty water glasses.  I decided at 50 minutes we were leaving.  Lo and behold at 47 minutes it comes out. Bland and soggy as we've ever tasted.  Opposite of what we expected from such an "upscale" Italian dining experience.    They never apologized for the long wait for our food and pretended everything was normal and fine.  We scarfed it down in a hurry to leave and asked for the bill. The waitress put it on the table and then took almost 10 minutes more to return to charge it when we were obviously packed up and ready to go.  We just walked up to the register and had someone else nearby handle it for us.  My husband went to pull the car around while I finished up with the bill.    Look, I know these are first world problems, and truthfully, my husband and I always enjoy each others company so much that we hardly notice a long wait for our food... PLUS... we were there on a gift card....     But we were trying to make it to a show that night and ended up arriving late and all for a meal that kinda sucked.  Even worse, when my husband and I got up to leave, a table of 2 next to us received their food---- they had only been seated 15 minutes earlier!!!!  I never complain about waitstaff mostly because I used to be a waitress, but what pushed me so far as to get on yelp about it is what I witnessed on the way out the door.  While I was standing by the door waiting for them to charge our card, A very elderly woman whom I had noticed was standing there a long time, asked the hostess..."how much longer for a table?"  and the hostess said..."About 20 more minutes".  The elderly woman replied.."Thats what you said 20 minutes ago, and I see 5 empty tables."  The hostess got very rude with her and retorted "Ma'am, some people plan ahead and make reservations, and its impossible to tell you the exact amount of time you will need to wait because we dont know how much longer people will be staying. They might order dessert, or more drinks. You can go to another establishment."  Seeing this old woman as I would my own grandmother, I stuck my neck out and spoke up to the hostess.   I said..."Listen, I've noticed this woman standing here a very long time.  You don't have any chairs for people up here to sit in and wait, so shes just been standing here. If you told her the wait was going to be 20 minutes, you need to seat her after 20 minutes.  If you were'nt sure exactly how long the wait would be, you should have told her that in the first place instead of getting angry at her for going by what YOU SAID.  Also, it would'nt hurt to show a little more respect to your elders."    The hostess looked at her friend and rolled her eyes sarcasticly as to say..."who is this bi***?"  hahahaha.  VERY RUDE. VERY.   WORST SERVICE IN YEARS. SORRY.   Dishonorable staff.  Unimpressive food.

YPgEDvHzXPI47wE8J93sDw.text: It really is 5 star. Food, service..etc. Through the back door and up the stairs is the most awesome wine bar. Pizza is totally rad. Mix of attire so everyone can be fashionable.  Patio is great. Great date place. Bathroom is 5 star also ( yes I'm now rating bathrooms after a few bad Larry David like episodes).

T1vs44vxqDzsDV4BKgvbEQ.text: This trendy little place has great pizza.  Pizza that makes you feel like you might be eating healthy because this is not a heavy pizza.  I love the slight spiciness of the sauce and the thinness of the crust.  It can be a little on the pricey side but it is worth it.  Expect lines on Friday and Saturday.  Check out the patio in the summer time.  I used to live in Lebo and miss this place since moving to Charlotte, NC over four years ago.  I stop at Il Pizzaiolo every time I am back in town.  Charlotte really needs a place like this and the closest attempt is Brixx Pizza.  Been there a few times and the ingredients are not up to par with Il Pizzaiolo.

LlrDFvOsGqohhm45eRLyyg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile. Supposedly, they have an extensive Italian beer selection and a wood-fired oven, so off my hubby and I went. I looked over the menu and discovered they only had two (2) Italian beers (Moretti, Peroni). Disappointed but not giving up, we ordered one of each and proceeded. The waiter (Adam) comes over and tells about the specials before leaving again so we have time to make a choice. FYI - the wait staff tries to class up the place by acting as if they've lived in Italy and personally prepared the food so we played along. We ordered a few appetizers to try, salads, and I ordered a Pizza Margherita and my hub-a-bub ordered a Calzone. After we order, Adam brings us some squares of wood fired bread with EVOO. The bread was thick and doughy (clearly a filler). Then comes the appetizers along with the salads. We ordered Rice Balls (both cheese and cheese and meat), which had *no* flavor. We also ordered the the Potato Croquettes, which tasted *sour*. The salads looked fresh but was all green until you dug down to the bottom of the plate where there were two small pieces of red and orange pepper, a cherry tomato, and an olive. Said salad would have been really tasty, had the vinaigrette not been too sweet. Next came the entrees. The place is suppose to be known for their pizzas (that Adam said was a thin crust personalized pizza) but what I was served was a big blob of pizza dough with some cheese and sauce on top. My hub-a-bub's Calzone was a huge blob of thinly stuffed dough with some cheese and sauce on top. Clearly these folks haven't been to Italy or know what True Neapolitan Pizza looks like. Needless to say, I couldn't bring myself to touch or eat what amounted to a loaf of bread (aka an Il Pizzaiolo Pizza) but paid for it anyway. A $100 later, we would have been much happier, and better off to stay at home enjoying a good red wine, a fresh loaf of Italian bread, and a hunk of Parma cheese!      Later that evening, my iron stomach started to gurgle. Needless to say, I ended up riding the porcelain bus in one bathroom, with my hub-a-bub in the other, for the rest of the evening.  All I can say if you eat there, be ready for a bumpy ride. Happy eating!

UCAow8wKtXL66DdDOpxuYg.text: I have been to Il Piz several times overthe past few years and I have yet to be impressed. Don't get me wrong, the food has always been good, but not fantastic and a little over priced. Yes, I've had the pizza. Yes, I've had several pasta dishes. None of which has changed my mind. I don't understand why there is always such a long wait for a table here.  My latest trip was on a warm Saturday night. I met a few friends on the patio for dinner. I arrived a llittle late and with baby in tow. I specifically asked for them to order me a glass of wine so it was on the table when I arrived. Unfortunately, for my dining companion, I miscalculated the size of baby + diaper bag and knocked over the glass of wine spilling it all over his yellow shirt. It almost looked like a tie dyed effect. The wait staff rushed to our side bringing him a glass of seltzer water and me a new glass of wine (I later found out at no charge). Seltzer water had nothing on the masterpeice I created. The shirt was officially retired. Once we got settled, I ordered the insalata misticanza. Despite the fancy name, it's a rather typical salad with balsamic, greens and some typical veggies. Nothing extravagant here, especially for 11$. For my entree, I had the fusilli ala ragu di bracioli. The pasta was cooked well. The beef was a little dry. The sauce was ok. I decided to not take home my left overs. Overall, my bill ended up being 40$. For a salad, pasta dish and 1 glass of wine. This same meal would average at least 5 dollars less at an equivalent restaurant. The best thing about the meal was the service. The server was knowledgeable, attentive and friendly. Overall, I will most likely go back to Il Piz because it is such a staple in the South Hills area, though it would not be by my choice.

Gq6KTVFZ3Bz1nizU9ShaVw.text: PLEASE take heed of the many warnings on this website.  I too once loved this restaurant, but we have had far too many terrible experiences to ever return.  Our first bad experience was a year and a half ago.  My parents were visiting from out of town and my husband and I decided to take them here.  We were told the wait would be 30-45 minutes.  We were lucky enough to find two seats at the wine bar so we could share a bottle of vino and take turns sitting.  An hour went by... then an hour and fifteen minutes... We began to notice that some parties coming into the bar area after us were seated before us.  Then, we were finally told our table was ready and to follow them... only for one of the hostesses to stop the waitress who was seating us.  She told the waitress that the table was for someone else.  We then watched as they sat a party who had been waiting for less than 20 minutes.  I can only presume these people were friends with one of the hostesses.  At this point, over 90 minutes had passed and we were understandably upset.  I complained to the manager, a middle aged woman who showed absolutely no concern for the situation they had caused.  We should have left, but instead we ordered another bottle and waited another 20 minutes for our table in the extremely noisy front dining room.  My husband absolutely refused to go to this location after that incident, so our next incident was not until this past week.  We made reservations for a Friday night and I specifically requested a quiet table in the wine room if one was available.  I noted that we would be willing to switch our reservation to a half hour before or after if that gave us a better chance, knowing they can't completely control such things.  When we arrived, the hostesses appeared to be the same teenage or 20-something girls who worked here a year ago.  I don't know if they were or if this restaurant simply has a steady stream of insolent young girls from which to draw.  The girls looked at each other, continued to giggle and continue whatever conversations they had already been having, and eventually pulled out a couple menus for us.  They led us to a table for 8 which already had 4 people.  They then gestured towards the table and asked "is this okay?".  We responded that no, we had made a reservation and there were at least two open tables in the front dining room, so we expected to be sat there, outside or at the wine bar (we checked - there was a table open in the same room as the wine bar and one outside).  The girl then informed us that it would be another 20-30 minutes if we didn't want to sit at someone else's table.  I have never known Il Pizzaiolo to be communal seating so this was completely unacceptable.  We left and gave our business to another restaurant on the same street, where we had excellent food and excellent service.   This portion is regarding the other location downtown:  Our third bad experience was the Market Square location this past Sunday.  We have had one less than favorable experience there before (they told my husband and I it would be a 2 hour wait for a table for 8, then told someone else from our party it would be 15 minutes only 10 minutes later... ), but we were willing to justify it and hoped it was an anomaly.  Sadly, they now seem to hire from the same pool as the Mt. Lebanon location.  We were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait for an outdoor table as 3 different 4 tops were finishing their dinner.  They said they would call us so we took a walk and returned 15 minutes later.  We waited at a public table in Market Square and WATCHED as the host and hostess cleared and then sat the 2 of the 4 tops.  When we went in to ask what was going on, we saw that all three 4 tops were actually resat.  We reminded them we were waiting and asked them when they would have our table ready.  We were told it would be another 20 minutes.  Goodbye!  Ciao, Il Pizzaiolo!  Never again.  We were able to be seated at Sienna immediately.    Ownership should be ashamed.  I don't know whether it is nepotism in the host positions or a complete lack of respect for their clientele.  I should add that on every occasion, a remark was made to at least a hostess, if not management, and no one offered even a sincere apology.  It is sad that people are willing to put up with this level of service.  There are plenty of other fine establishments in Pittsburgh, particularly Italian ones.  I have a whole list of Italian restaurants that have as good or better food, that would never treat their patrons like this.

GhyzUT1oIITRsuUakTsoZg.text: good food and adequate waitstaff, however the rudeness of the host staff spoiled the meal. we arrived on time for a 6:30 reservation on a 65 degree day.  we were told that we were to be seated outside. when i protested, the hostess rolled her eyes and said, fine then sit there, as she pointed to a tiny table in the worst possible place next to the waiting area. i declined, and she replied with sit outside then or you'll have to wait. even though the dining area was less than half full, we caved and followed her outside to a metal table in the shade and proceeded to freeze. my elderly father had blue fingers by the end of the meal which we rushed through to get home and be warm. on the upside, we appear to have been treated the same as many other guests. i watched as party after party was led outside, protested, and told essentially to suck it up or leave.  i suggest being very specific about wanting to sit inside but not in the waiting area when making your reservation.  or just get takeout instead and skip the bad part of the experience at this place.

ARiHDV7AftqGlLcjMZKoMg.text: Excellent thin crust pizza served in a pleasant rustic Tuscany style restaurant along with the Pizza we enjoyed a very nice caesar salad with anchovy and a fresh zesty citrus dressing The wine list is also very good, heavy on Italian wines with some good by the glass specials Service is professional & prompt

ID_uZvlkN-W1ZvpbA1ymvA.text: fantastic food and wine! Had the bolognese and some other chicken dish that was amazing!

5vPdykwSIXCq6YkF6Myapg.text: I'm well overdue for an update of this place, as it slowly became one of my regular spots in Pittsburgh since the review of my first visit.  Here's what you need to know: This is the most authentic pizza in Pittsburgh. Hands down. There are NO other contenders. In fact, this is the ONLY place in Pennsylvania that is VPN (Verace Pizza Napoletana)-certified to make a True DOC pizza, so it's not really a debatable point.  If you don't like authentic pizza, fine (but I think you're insane). For me, having the most authentic pizza also means they make the best pizza. DOC margherita pizza is one of my favorite foods in the world, and I ate it at least once a week when I was living in Florence. Il Pizzaiolo is very, very, very close to the real thing in Italy. If you call yourself a pizza snob, you need to get here, order a DOC margherita with mozzarella di bufala, and maybe a rucola e proscuitto while you're at it. You can thank me later.  The pasta is also excellent, but not as good as Dish in the South Side so I only order it if I'm with a group. Pizza, though. Mmmmm...

BEJdskVJu77d2uE8UHnzcA.text: You can't wrong with any of the pizza choices here. Some of the best Italian and pizza in the city. Would also recommend the penne vodka for dinner and Sicilian sour to drink. Fantastic wine bar and patio.

b0OEKbpGPblPNK9RkI_lcA.text: We are lucky enough to live within walking distance to il Pizzaiolo. Love the pizza and they have the best vodka sauce. We end up getting takeout a lot from here and it never disappoints!

EUeUpfKy-tVlRiG_AtKPsg.text: The enoteca in the back is my favorite place to grab a glass of wine with a friend while noshing on the antipasti plate. The staff is quite knowledgable about wines. It's cozy, so be prepared to get crowded out every once in awhile.

idvpQ_W1WBpt2VQ8U9nkpg.text: I'm not sure what the Mt.Lebo hype is about this place. The portions are small, the place is small, and the foods no more than average. I have been there twice now, thinking the first time might have been a fluke. We've heard so much about it that I have super high expectations. Their wine bar in the back is cute, but small. We couldn't even lift our elbows to sip our drink. While the waiters and service are good, the food is just not impressive. The pasta I got was good, but nothing to write home about. I got a pizza the second time I visited and it had a horrid taste. I don't know if it was the spinach or the cheese but something was VERY potent. They're pricy as well. The only thing I will give them credit for their Italian wedding soup. There's practically nothing in it, as they use think rice instead of noodles, but the broth and meatballs are to die for! Overall, not impressed. I probably won't return.

AruySblD8bedhUeOwW44jQ.text: I can honestly say this is the BEST Neapolitan pizza I've ever had.  A first timer, I was told that Il Pizzaiolo is one of a handful of pizzerias in the country certified to make authentic Neapolitan pizza.  In addition, their amazing mozzarella is flown in directly from Naples! We tried the Caprese salad (absolute heaven-- the mozzarella really makes this dish) and the Diavola pizza (spicy salumi,mozzarella, and a spicy, salty tomato sauce).  The waiter was kind enough to show us the backseat outdoor patio, which we will certainly visit the next time we're here, as well as their back lounge, which was equipped with comfy couches and a bar if you're interested in a nightcap after dinner. I'm excited to go back and try their pasta!

HRWLxI9_OHYu8acr95rSYg.text: Hands down Best pizza in pittsburgh. It's a little pricey being $15 for a pie but so worth it.

AUB6XrBjjmeWRl6PdtLj7w.text: Il Pizz....to my entourage and I is a great corner stone of the MTL dining scene. Every dish I have ever had here has been nothing but excellent.   I can really appreciate the effort that this place puts into its products. If they have their homemade burrata, which has such a nice mellow flavor and texture of silk, I recommend giving it a try. If you have never had it before, it is very runny and creamy so don't be alarmed that is how it is supposed to be. They serve it with a simple side of Heirloom tomato slices with a bit of salt and pepper which makes this a refreshing summer appetizer.   I can't write enough to describe everything I have tried on their menu but most recently I had one of their many styles of pizza. The Funghi pizza had a most flavorful sauce and with tasty mushroom, mozz cheese, basil. It is cooked in a wood fired oven and fresh ingredients make these rather simple pies, gourmet.   The drink menu is vast with many tasty wines and beers, domestic and imported. I agree with some other reviews that the drink prices are a little on the steep side but I think it makes up for the more than reasonable food prices. I think that the most inexpensive wine on the list is $9 a glass.   The service is usually excellent although I have had extremely long wait times which I think is caused by the fact that this is a great place that draws plenty of people in and many folks enjoy hanging out after dinner since the ambiance is pretty nice. I have also had them tell me the wait was almost 2 hours and was seated in 20 minutes???? Don't understand that one. I recommend in the summer months seeing if you can grab a seat on their back patio and I also enjoy dining in their back dinning room (wine bar) as it is usually a little quieter and intimate feeling than the front dining area. Take some time and enjoy the experience.

0QWcSQmHZVCBUZo6R5k1mg.text: One of the earliest places making Neopolitan pizza in Pittsburgh - and they've mostly remained consistent over the years (though the pizzas are a little smaller). The Margherita DOC is as good as what you get in Italy. The Sicilian eggplant pasta is excellent !!

_yanm9Dk2oOp79B5SC5dAw.text: I don't really know where to start...It was my best friends birthday...we were being spontaneous...the amazing staff there welcomed us after lunch...(open all day) and served us the most amazing Italian meal I've ever had! (Both Toni and I are Italian and are amazing cooks...so the compliment is not given lightly) We proceeded to order pizza, the best antipasto in the flippin' world, 4 pastas and a to die for cannoli! I promised the manager I would be back in July when I return from LA and we will have a party! I actually ended up there the next day with another best friend and again...amazing! Thinking about Il Pizzaiolo makes my mouth water...I can wait to return!

dNmyJUXoySJ6fEGAaaCW2Q.text: Great Italian. Cool cozy wine bar. I guess it's not really their fault since they were packed, but they seated us in the table right next to the door where everyone waiting to be seated was standing right beside our table. Plus every time someone opened the door, a cold wind hit every table close by. There were 2-3 tables that were wearing their coats the whole time. Other than this, would highly recommend.

8OlsL3nURsueI2zxmMFhHw.text: The appetizer was bruschetta.  Essentially three pieces of toast with various toppings.  Two of the three were good, but the brocolinni topped one was not my taste.  Certainly, this was NOT worth the $12 price.  Our dinner was pizza.  The crust was very good - almost like a soft, warm, flat breadstick.  Sadly, the pizza was sparsely topped with cheese and sausage.  Our server was attentive, almost to a fault.  The restaurant was excessively loud - we couldn't hear the waitress rattle off the soup, appetizer or entree specials (seven specials in total).  While the food was not bad, I can't justify the prices or quantities.  In fact, I really didn't pull up Yelp to rate this restaurant...I'm actually looking for a place to go eat since I'm still famished after "eating" here.

PIS6YzBzEgCS3k8hcqi-Vw.text: Now, this isn't the best pizza I have ever had, but it is the most authentic and that is why it is getting 5-stars.  I was craving and in search of a place where I could get the most authentic DOC style Italian pizza, and I honestly think that this place is the best I have ever had at making a certified Margarita pizza.  I cannot wait to go back: luckily, my grandma lives across the street!!

iwUi8aXsRTHGWQEZQOhaLg.text: Excellent food but a little pricey.  The pizza and antipasta dishes are amazing.

djRYgjG-vudepnelP-L-Ug.text: . Ordered pasta and waited. Others in party ordered pizza The pasta was cold and the sauce was dried.  Must have sat on the prep counter for 15 minutes waiting for the pizza. It's an overpriced pizza joint which has gone downhill.

vjQ5SfS4tSh7eZrGK-bGYw.text: Food is delicious but I gave it 4 stars because the last two times we have been there the kitchen was so backed up we waited over an hour for our food. Once they brought us free meatballs to hold us over. The next time it was free pizza and wine. Would think twice about going back.

GGf9M259m5jYBfIkHAsJLw.text: Everything here is fantastic.  The drinks and food always leave us fully satisfied.  They really give extra care and attention to cocktail specials and menu items.  The downstairs bar staff and manager are especially great.  They all have a strong passion for excellent service.  If they are really busy, you may not get a seat, or sometimes they might close early on slow nights, but that's just the way it goes.  It's just smart business tactics.  The really negative reviews on here seem to be mostly frivolous not pertaining to their product.  So those should be ignored.  Anyway, we keep coming back for more of the good stuff, and eventually we hope to try the entire menu.

4BahDDWyKmVrCO40fj9BnA.text: Great service,amazing food and wonderful atmosphere,highly recommend,come back.Kitchen works till 9pm

Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PzeCQcHzzYR6JDymuTsyDw.text: My boyfriend surprised me with an early Valentine's Day dinner tonight at Il Pizzaiolo.  Neither of us had ever been before and after tonight's experience, it would be beyond fair to say we will be coming back pretty regularly.  With not much standing room to wait, without being in the way, we wound up waiting outside between the restaurant and wine bar for about 45 minutes or so for a table.  The hostess was amazing, despite the long (but completely worthwhile) wait.  She kept us updated if she happened by and found us a cozy spot in the main restaurant.  Neither of us realized we would be taken care of by a wonderful server, whom the rest of the staff kept referring to as one of the best ever.  Emily gave us suggestions, knowing that we this was our first visit and answered every menu question we had.  She gave us extra info on the dishes we ordered and never left us waiting for anything we asked for.  We started with an order of the meatballs and a caprese salad.  Everything we ordered had much fancier names than I'm remembering, so please excuse that lol.  Both appetizers were incredible.  I generally have to add salt when I order a caprese salad but there was no need this time.  Both appetizers were impeccably seasoned and delicious.  For entrees, we had a pasta sausage and rapini dish...as well as a house made tortelloni, stuffed with mascarpone cheese and spinach.  There are not words to describe how much we both enjoyed our entrees.  Again, everything was perfectly seasoned and sauced just right.  To finish, we ordered the flourless chocolate cake and the most decadently light lemon pastry cake I've ever had.  The saddest part of the meal was when it was over.  This is one of the longest reviews I've ever written and if you made it to the end, thank you lol.  The food was epic and Emily is truly amazing.  Give this place a try ASAP!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Light and delicate lemon cake, filled with impossibly delicious lemon pastry cream.  I just...there aren&#39;t words.
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flourless.chocolate.sea salt.cake...goodness.
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House made tortelloni, stuffed with mascarpone cheese and spinach...lightly sauced with an amazing and velvety alfredo sauce

HI7P_VXm3WZSTjnp7_sF9A.text: Need somewhere intimate and cozy for a date? Definitely head to the wine bar at Il Pizzaiolo. While it can be crowded on the weekends, this small building behind the main restaurant is a gem.  The main restaurant is also fantastic. The food is consistently good, and the staff is extremely knowledgeable. Make a reservation unless you go early or for lunch.

IjfsnNjmUxqwDr3ZRFkmig.text: I love this place. Consistent delicious food, friendly service and a cozy welcoming atmosphere   Lemon chicken is awesome as are all of their pizzas. Every time we stay in Mt Lebo it is a must stop

UFORvMVlO6mvCmC5Wzqf1Q.text: The perfect date night location! It's not a huge place so when you get there, there is a high chance you will have to wait awhile to be seated. That's not necessarily a bad thing though. Head to the back, go out the door, and go up the stairs of the building behind it. They have a small bar and waiting area by the fire place where you can have a drink and chat in the meantime. This cute little area was definitely my favorite part of the visit. We waited about an hour to be seated so we were definitely hungry by the time our food came. I got the gnocchi sorrentina. It was very good but I wish there would have been more protein on it. We left very satisfied with the experience. If you give this place a try, I recommend getting there earlier in the evening to avoid waiting for a long time.

lUUFCDzPeOvwuZ2IeA-Z4g.text: Overall, not what I expected. No reservations are taken here, which is unusual, but we were seated immediately ~ 7:30pm -- however the minute I took my coat off I realized I couldn't bear the cold, outside draft moving through the restaurant. Looks like perhaps the front door doesn't close/seal entirely. I don't get cold easily, but I wore my coat until about half way through dinner, until the wine could warm me up. Restaurant is trendy, unique, and aesthetically cozy, but 3 stars on the cold atmosphere. In terms of service, it was 3 stars at best. The place just seemed to be in disarray. We had to ask for water, twice... replacement silverware, twice...  extra plates, twice...we also wanted to order a bottle of wine, so sampled a few -- but the samples looked more like the minuscule amount of wine that you leave in your glass when you've finished. When we decided on a bottle, the server poured me another drip to taste.... so i politely asked for a bit more to truly taste it. All in all, the server was very kind, but I think they were suffering from a general snafu around the restaurant. I also think the wine education could be improved with the servers! Actual wine was great ! The Arancini was also a great appetizer for the table. However, following we were told that our dinner check had been lost and we were asked to re-verify our order. It happens, but from there it took awhile to get our food. Tables who sat after us were served first. Following that our both of our table's pizzas came out undercooked and doughy.  It wasn't unbearable, but I certainly wasn't going to send it back after everything we had been through. With that said, i did try some pasta, sausage, and meatball from my friends dish -- the meatballs were on-point and amazing.  I'd come back, but not rushing to do so.

vNuw8qO1qydoUBH3JaLHVw.text: Being slightly biased because I did work at this location for a little while, I enjoy everything on the menu. From behind the scenes I assure any of their homemade pastas or Neapolitan style pizza is a must try. My personal favorite is the ravioli or gnocchi.

d2tVXwu_yO-Il8qQUohsjA.text: We really enjoyed our first time here! It was a Saturday night and we had a 25 min wait, but were directed to the cozy wine bar which had a nice fireplace where we could wait and had an awesome wine selection. We then ordered wedding soup, lemon chicken, and sausage pizza. All of the food was fantastic. Bread and oil comes with the food. The oil was not very good in our opinion so that would be the only downside. Staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our service. The ambiance was very nice and relaxing. Perfect for our anniversary dinner.

85RxE5uo8m5EaIjephN-bg.text: OH Wow! What a terrible place to eat! The pizzas were not fully cooked and the sauce had absolutely no flavor. Very expensive!!! Poor food quality and high prices = This was a one and done. We will not return! I caution anyone that is thinking of going there not to go because you will be highly disappointed!

o5lcItEbfYjbnaA_Lm6BHg.text: Came here on a Thursday evening with reservations. Unfortunately, could not sit on the patio due to the rainy weather. Easy to make reservations online. We started off with bread and oil and then ordered the prosciutto e arugula pizza and the gnocchi sorrentina for the two of us.   The food came pretty quickly. Also the diet coke was served in a cute little glass bottle. We started off with the pizza, which looked and tasted amazing. It was a white pizza, with cherry tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, parmesan, topped with arugula and prosciutto. It was fresh, delicious, and had a great combination of textures and flavors between the crunchy arugula and softer prosciutto. Hands down one of the best pizzas I have had in Pittsburgh. The gnocchi was also perfectly cooked. Each one was a little pocket of joy especially with the fresh mozzarella. The sauce could have been a little more flavorful but the handmade gnocchi made up for it.   For desert, we had the cannoli. It was definitely big enough to split with one end being dusted in pistachio and the other end covered in mini chocolate chips. The cannoli cream filling was decadent and I just wanted to keep on eating it. Overall, had a lovely meal here and will be back. Everything was made perfectly and tasted authentic.

P-d-nSXPLAa2wtmmuyvpMw.text: Love this Mt Lebo favorite! Always a great meal - pizza, pasta, and everything in between! The arancini are a MUST for an appetizer. Highly recommend checking out this spot for delicious Italian eats!

zVUuzm2qV5ANtZGg84mRpg.text: Used to be better. Not sure what happened that made it lose it's luster. Not as good as 2012. Not sure they will ever get back there. It's too bad... closest place to homeland Italian cooking.

alFKZRmXeWKUyjzThLcxSw.text: I should start by saying I normally love this place.  That's about the only positive thing I have to say today, though.  Caesar salad for lunch in Uptown Mt. Lebo - that's all I wanted.  Seems easy enough, right?  Only one place to get it that was local and easy (not cheap).  I'm pretty excited, because it's like 1:30 pm and the lunch rush should be over.  So, I get the ball rolling.  I call Il Pizzaiolo; no answer.  Call again; no answer.  Third time, someone picks up.  I order my caesar salad with chicken.  I'm told 30 minutes (30 minutes to chop some lettuce and grate some cheese?  Pretty sure the chicken was already ready to go.  Neat.).  Fast forward 30 minutes: walk down the street (10 minute walk) and pick up my [$17] salad [that probably cost $3 to make].  Walk 10 minutes back to the office.  Get everything ready to eat... but that's when it hits me.  NO DRESSING.  A caesar salad without dressing is just chopped up lettuce and chicken.  Or, a chicken salad, if you will.  I didn't order a sad chicken salad, did I?  Nope.  So I figure ok, fine.  Things happen.  I'll call them and see if they can just have the dressing ready for me to grab.  So I call - no one answers.  Call again - "Il Pizzaiolo, can you hold please?"  Sure.  Sure I can.  2 minutes.  5 minutes. 7 minutes.  I've already started walking back at this point.  10 minutes.  11 minutes.  I walk in, still on hold and there are 2 people at the register.  They look at me.    I let them know I picked up my caesar salad (20 minutes ago, at this point) and there was no dressing in it.  Then I showed them my phone and asked if anyone needed to pick up the caller on hold.  I could see the red light blinking (for anyone who isn't following along: I was still on hold).  "Who put you on hold?!?!"  Lady, I don't work here.    Other guy goes to kitchen.  Gets dressing.  Comes back.  "Sorry, I dunno what happened there."  Well, friend, if you have the time - I wrote it all out for you to review, on Yelp.  Have at it.  Did I mention I'm 7 months pregnant, and it's my birthday?  (I couldn't make this up if I tried.)  Xo.

zY1dh0lOLruByLuUKcvykA.text: My friends told me to go there because it's fantastic and they were right.  From the food, to the service, to the decoration : WOAW and thank you!   Al dente pasta, tasty pizza crust... I had a blast! The tiramisu is exactly as EXCELLENT as my mother's!!

XR_uRXX9wabyUZ_9K1BdzQ.text: Everyone I know says Il Pizzaiolo in Mount Lebanon has the best Italian in Pittsburgh, even when compared to the downtown location. From my experience at the two locations, I find it difficult to compare the two directly because they're quite different in some ways. The menus aren't exactly the same and the ambience is a complete 180. The Mt. Lebo location is quaint and is decorated in warm colors, making it feel like you're in Italy.   When my husband and I came here, we ordered the Arancini, Pollo Marsala, and Gnocchi Sorrentina. The bread they serve is their pizza dough, which was quite nice! For the arancini, we ordered two meat and two cheese. I would say the cheese were far better so I recommend getting four cheese ones. They were served in marinara sauce which made it even better. Both our entrees were delicious. The chicken marsala was so moist and flavorful, while the gnocchi were light and fluffy. Just an FYI, all their pastas are made in-house except the spaghetti, rigatoni, and penne. Maybe the linguine too, but I don't quite remember that detail.   I personally would prefer this location to the downtown location, as I much prefer the quiet atmosphere here.

WoI71fIcPvsiH6yZY1bNGQ.text: Fantastic. Came here for the first time and left fully satisfied. Nice decor, nice ambiance, terrific food.

p6N_liAaOE1CUykcN_wsCg.text: Visiting from Orlando, FL. While there are many different Italian restaurants and pizzeria in Pittsburgh. We decided to venture away from downtown to Uptown Mt.Lebanon. this restaurant is one of the few VPN certified pizza restaurants I  the world! It is a "True Neapolitan Pizza. The light dough cooked in the brick oven truly makes this pizza unique.  We ordered the Magherita pizza. This is the most simple pizza they have and you can't go wrong with it.  It's topped with fresh mozzarella,  basil and extra virgin olive oil.   Also tried the Salumiera pizza.  It has fresh mozzarella, Mortadella, Prosciutto, salami and am Italian salad on top that includes fresh tomatoes and lettuce.  Ended the meal with an espresso,  cappuccino,  and scoops of strawberry & pistachio gelato.  Yum!   Our total bill came out to be around $50 pretip.

ykoiasa8005nd6eZ7Mfx4Q.text: My boo and I came here because I drive by it every day and it is always filled with people. Great menu selection, love the atmosphere, service was a little slow but I think it was just our waitress and there were groups of friends, couples and even families with children. So basically, appropriate for any occasion.  I thoroughly enjoyed the salad that we split and for our entree we ordered the gnocchi. The gnocchi itself was better than most places but the sauce was a little bit on the sweet side for my taste.   We will def be back!

3knPRBtoVOkWP6MRzv-5Qw.text: Best meal I have EVER had in Pittsburgh! Service was excellent. I would eat here everyday if I could!

1FOrS6uhYSRHqx_oblJ-iA.text: After living in Italy for 7 months during my college years I can say that I have a voice in the discussion of what first-rate Italian should taste like. Just so you all know I have tried almost every dish on the menu but will stick to what in my opinion is the best. I did not leave 5 stars because I do think it is a bit overpriced. The last time I went my server was really impatient and snobby when I was asking questions and trying to decide on the wine.  I arrived before the dinner rush on my birthday so I could take the time to really dine with my boyfriend.   Why I crave Pizzaiolo? Mozzarella di bufala. I know for a fact that every Thursday they fly in many choice ingredients directly from Italia. This creamy delicacy is by far my best loved. It either comes on the DOC Margherita pizza or mixed in with some of the pasta selections. I always order the DOC as an appetizer then the Rigatoni Alla Siciliana. They also only use San Marzano tomatoes in the marinara sauces which introduces a bold rich flavor without as much acidity. The key to these dense, deep red fruits is that they are grown in the fertile volcanic soil in Italy.  The Siciliana is an eggplant based dish that I find myself desiring often in my favorite dish spankbank. The perfect texture of the al dente pasta combined with the melt in your mouth salty, tart smoothness of the mozzarella and eggplant in the sweet heavily basil based garlic sauce is a party for the taste buds. I just keep eating until I am uncomfortably full. The wine selection is also above par, I enjoy the Berro Barberra. Full bodied, spicy, splashes of berry, and low in tannins.   As for the pizza, it is reminiscent of the famous brick oven pizzas of Da Michele found in only Napoli. The crust is extremely thin, light. and crispy. Follow that with my "Piece de resistance" mozzarella di bufala, tangy san marzano tomato sauce, and fresh leaves of basil you will find that simplicity is more. (yes I know that reference is french) So mangia bene at Il Pizzaillo

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Siciliana with mozzarella di bufala
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lasagna

6uxScWxtBpmwJCZa5E92pA.text: I love this restaurant, especially the Mt Lebanon location. The pizza here is phenomenal! It's hard to find a pizzeria where the dough, the sauce and the cheese are all delicious. My personal favorite is the margherita with DOC mozarella. The pasta is also great here - perfectly al dente. I would skip out on the apps except the neapolitan vegetables. The only negative I see is the noise level at dinner time. Otherwise, I absolutely love going here!

QvZYnIddGGnBBG2cwWOatA.text: First of all, Sarah was the most awesome waitress!!! Loved her wine selection suggestions, as well as dinner entree recommendations! The Paccheri Alla Siciliana was a wonderful marinara sauce tossed with eggplant Fresh Bufula Mozzarella balls and was delicious!  The pappardelle al funghi, a delicious while wine and olive oil sauce, was tossed with pasta and shiitake mushrooms!  Both dishes were delicious and the amazing pure ricotta cannoli for dessert, excellent!!!  Highly recommend this restaurant. We ate in the upstairs wine bar. But will definitely come back to sit in the beautiful courtyard garden!

TmwDTKoG47LIDOJOy7KLqQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. The food is always amazing, but you're probably going to wait a little bit for a table - especially if you want to sit outside on the patio, which I absolutely recommend. While you're waiting check out the quaint wine bar in the back. Servers are knowledgeable and attentive. Overall a great place to enjoy authentic Italian cuisine.

dhMZrRHGqmQw2tiymT88nA.text: Very expensive blah pizza...tried Margherita and White pizza and neither had great flavor...plus I can't figure out why a bottle of wine cost more than 4 plus individual glasses of the same wine...shouldn't it be cheaper to buy a bottle?? I did like the wine bar and the service was great...if I would ever go back I may try a different dish and order water.

fXLUYFNtGt1O9QlecS571A.text: Awesome... grabbed a pizza and some vino on the couches by the bar in wine-loft, out back. Looks like a cool patio for summer dining al-fresco, as well.   Looking forward to next time and trying the tiramisu.

wX--o375U5iAOcfovAQ1Yw.text: We went for the pizza, because of other reviews we had heard. The pizza was good, not the best and very small. The wine bar in the back has the best atmosphere. Our waiter was the best part,very nice and knowledgeable. It has two $$, but should have $$$$, We left with a bill $60+ for 2 people and were/are still hungry, and Hope you know how to read Italian, Also we clearly had been underdressed in jeans. We will not be going back.

8rIxHSuYxKaoQQinCwNvTg.text: Favorite Italian in pittsburgh.  Good service, wait times are bearable on weekends (the wine loft makes it easy to wait).  Fantastic food - top choices are the mozzarella and prosciutto appetizer, meatballs app, all pizzas, and gnocchi.  Can't go wrong with anything though.  Dinner can be pricey but worth it for such good food and quality ingredients.

oQUUmrANeTRfivmgDoRDSw.text: Maybe it's because I was in the mood for pizza or maybe, just maybe it was really that good!  My friend and I ordered the rice/risotto stuffed with mozarella appetizer (don't rememeber the name) and the Margherita Pizza - it was sooo good.  It's exactly what I wanted and everything was served hot and fresh.    The pizza was thin and delightfully tasteful - no one flavor really overpowered another.  And I'll tell you what, I'm not a big pizza crust eater, I actually haven't eaten the crust of a pizza for years - well that infamous night at Il Pizzaiola put a stop to that trend.  I ate every piece of that pizza slice including the crust.    If your in the mood for pizza check this place out!  It was a bit pricey just for pizza, but I thought it was worth it.

Zoh1-DpL3mwudgOBQ3T96w.text: Not impressed with food or service! For the price of these meals I would expect excellent service! Waiter was not thrilled to be at work on a Wednesday at 5pm. Short answers and we had to drink our water sparingly because he wasn't refilling them! I ordered the Margherita pizza and it was mainly sauce. I wish I would have gone to bistro 19 or mineos!

8j02VhAiFjOX-NvXNQQq2g.text: Excellent Italian restaurant. We ate in the wine bar behind the actual restaurant which was very nice and cozy. We shared the sea bass and eggplant parmesan. Portions were generous and the food was excellent. The eggplant parmesean was the best I have had and rather than the frequently found thin slices of breaded eggplant, this dish had nice thick slices with fresh mozzarella and basil. In addition to a great wine list they also had some unique beer selections. Although we did not try them, the brick oven pizzas also looked worth trying. Service was very attentive. We would return in a heartbeat.

a_jIHURB_NHSHbfPkJ2GAg.text: How could I forget to include:  My husband got sick off their food as soon as we stepped foot in our house.  Oh my!  Please do yourself a favor and avoid this place.  If you want atmosphere and good Italian, go to Dish.  If you want authentic, thin and crispy pizza, go to Piccolo Forno.  Fiori's has better pizza than this place and it doesn't cost $74.34 :(

GDUBaBNO_JvgWvAUnrG88w.text: I have tried II Pizzaiolo twice now and I am not a fan. The food was very good but over priced and the atmosphere is stuffy and very loud. If you are looking for a relaxing night out, this is not the place to go.

-xzRp-OqXa6_K3hyn9EFSA.text: While in Pittsburgh with the hubby for a quick weekend getaway, I took Misty B.'s (@chi_mist) recommendation and tried this place out.  Casual, but trendy, restaurant that was the perfect little date night.  The wine menu was good - and the server helped us pick out a few based on our tastes.  The food was VERY good. We had the Polpettini (mini meatballs) as an appetizer and they were all gone in about 5mins.  We shared two entrees: the DOC margherita pizza and a pasta special of the evening - penne with a lamb ragu.  The pizza... the pizza... the pizza.... I could eat the entire thing by myself. I forgot about the pasta, and to be honest, it couldn't stand up to the pizza.  This 5 star rating is absolutely for the best margherita pizza I've ever had - and thanks Misty for the awesome rec!

u9mXDKEle6o0ctW4ePQvdg.text: Full review with pictures in blog:   Greeted by our server, a friendly college age girl with an ever-present smile, our waters were filled and menus presented while we were left time to decide - time that would be welcome given the large size of the menu and the fact that I would have liked to try at least thirty items.  Discussing amongst ourselves while scouring other tables for evidence of portion size we eventually settled on one appetizer, two pastas, and a pizza...we then began the agonizing process of deciding which option sounded best.    Baked in house the first basket was had only three options while the second arrived with a fourth.  With each bread a great example of its particular type the baskets featured a smoky Rustic Italian, buttery Semolina Vienna, amply sour sesame seed crusted Sourdough, and a buttery moist Foccacia.  While I rather wish the pairing would have been a nice olive oil as opposed to butter neither were really necessary with all the sauce that required mopping up.  Beginning the meal as the sounds of eager diners bounced around the wonderfully decorated brick and tile interior was a delightful Arancini with creamy arborio rice providing a slightly toothsome contrast to velvety fried Mozzarella.   An ample portion for a mere $6 the dish was only enhanced by resting the crispy balls of cheese in a pool of house-made marinara.  Remember the comment about the bread - a whole basket was used to dredge the plate clean of the aromatic and slightly acidic sauce.  Selecting two of the eighteen pastas the pair was delivered simultaneously and looking back I still cannot decide which was better.  Beginning first with the Paglia E Fieno, a spinach and egg tagliatelle with peas, prosciutto di parma, parmigiano-reggiano, and cream I was stunned by the bouncy texture of the pasta to tooth yet its undeniable melt-in-the-mouth texture upon mastication...al dente done just right.  Complimenting the pasta were sweet and snappy peas, a smooth and salty prosciutto, and a pungent parmigiano-reggiano that added texture and pungency.  All balanced by a somewhat sweet cream sauce the entire dish was well thought out, well balanced, and divine.  Not to be outdone, Gnocchi Di Ricotta featuring Ricotta Gnocchi, Butter, Sage, and Parmigiana-Reggiano was a dish that would have the three of us fighting for the last dumpling.  Simply prepared, as one expects from a rustic dish like gnocchi, the dumplings were undoubtedly the star of the dish-literally melting puddles of potato and ricotta cheese that provided little resistance to tooth, yet enough body to support and absorb the subtly sweet and aromatic sauce.  Topped with a quick grating of cheese and cracked black pepper the gnocchi was one of the best I've ever tasted-a skilled hand, perfect cooking conditions, and largely un-fussed-with.  Enjoying all the previous efforts so much the "star" of the afternoon was nearly an afterthought-and one heck of an afterthought given that it is where the restaurant made its name.  Opting for the Provola with Smoked Mozzarella di bufala, Cherry Tomatoes, Fresh Basil, Parmigiano-Reggiano, Baby Arugula, and Extra Virgin Olive Oil we watched as the dough emerged from the temperature controlled room, was rolled by hand, topped and was placed inside the stone oven for a mere 90 seconds.  Emerging bubbly and charred the pizza was topped with a heap of fresh arugala, drizzled with olive oil and a quick shredding of Parmigiano-Reggiano before being plated and brought to the table.  Squeaky and smoky the cheese was a perfect foil for the cornmeal accented and yeasty dough.  Crisp and toasted around the circumference of the 13 inche pie and sopping wet at the center each ingredient was pronounced in flavor with the super sweet tomatoes and basil forming the foundation and the bite of the parmigiano and bitterness of the Arugula providing a nice compliment of flavor.  Arriving quickly and in ample portion the house made desserts were both presented simply and unadorned.  Beginning first with the Tiramisu-a rather standard example with buttery lady fingers, smooth mascarpone, high quality cocoa, ribbons of chocolate, and a hefty shot of rum-it was good, but like many pre-prepared versions it was largely unbalanced with the rum soaking the bottom layer and cream dominating the top.  Significantly more impressive was the Cannoli, a crisp and slightly cinnamon accented shell housing a lightly lemon tinged ricotta cream.  One end dipped in crushed pistachio, the other in chocolate chips, and sitting atop a bed of hand whipped cream-light, refreshing, and authentic.  Great service, everything expertly prepared, and prices that fit the quality of the ingredients I was very happy with every aspect of our meal.  Honestly, when the pizza, one of the best I've ever had was the "worst" savory...that is saying something.  Clearly I need to start paying attention to that Verace Pizza Napoletana Association list when I travel.

zcgLqL8h5NZBwoCI6JZsOw.text: I always used to make sure to have dinner here during my yearly visits to Pittsburgh. This will be the last time as the food was mediocre and the restaurant  looked like it was neglected. There are many new and better restaurants to choose from. The sad state this once cutting edge restaurant devolved into is a real shame as it used to be one of Pittsburgh's best.

hiGMD97FK-qTvmIbW_6gTA.text: Mt. Lebanon is such a cute little town! I was so happy we chose to eat dinner there, especially when we got a great, people-watching table right next to the window. Very relaxing before our 5-hour drive home the next day.  Il Pizzaiolo has a great, rustic atmosphere. Dark wood, tan walls, delicious pizza smells. And a full bar. Very important.  The service was eh. It took the waitress at least 10 minutes to greet us and take our drink order, another 5 to get drinks and tepid water for the table. (Ew, chill the water. I know you're going for a Euro atmosphere but you're not in Europe. Chill the damn water.) The appetizer got there after another 5 and then the pizza took forever. I don't know how since the menu claims they're cooked in 30 seconds in the wood burning oven. But no matter. On to the review.  T got a beer and I got a mimosa. They were out of the peach juice that usually goes in a mimosa so it was made with blood orange juice instead. Delicious.   For our appetizer we ordered a sort of potato stick with cheese mixed in. Forget the exact name and they don't seem to have a website where I can check. They were ... okay. A bit bland truth be told but the Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top helped a bit. There was no salt and pepper on the table and our waitress was a bit absent so we sucked it up and ate the bland potato stick things.  However, the pizza improved a somewhat mediocre appetizer. We got the Diavolo with spicy salami and chili flakes. Amazing. The crust was thin and chewy and not too black on the bottom. The cheese was salty and creamy and the salami was spicy and really tasty. Much better than pepperoni in my opinion.  I suppose it's a good spot if you're in the mood for Italian. I'm sure there are better in the Pittsburgh area.

fEQ4wjYjYrd1x5nM8c7ylw.text: Great-tasting food accompanied by great service. The antipasto and pizza margherita were a little different than we're used to, but were great nonetheless.

zAGNv9E6RylBGJpBA_ayRg.text: After having a Italian craving I stumbled onto this place for lunch. On walking in I was greeted and had a seat along the window. I liked the design of this place as it's very clean and has a comfortable vibe. I also like how you can see the brick oven and some of the food being made. I wanted lasagna but it wasn't offered on the lunch menu but the server was happy to still offer it to me but with mentioning that it will take some extra time to prepare. I wasn't worried about the wait. I started with the deep fried risotto balls 2 meat and 2 cheese. I have to admit they where outstanding and loaded with flavor. As for the bread it was good but the oil for dipping was absolutely terrible and completely flavorless. Now for the lasagna it was a smaller portion then you would expect but it had decent flavor and the sauce was great. It wasn't really loaded up with sausage and meatballs but overall I enjoyed it as I'm not a big lover of Italian food. I could definitely see my self returning here to try other items on the menu.
