23HrLW2PhStE33XkszHz6A.text: We had dinner here on a Friday evening dinner I would suggest that if you want a conversation with someone such as a date NOT to go. We were shouting to one another to hear each other over the top of the kitchen noise and other patrons. Some of the children were scream also because of the loud noise.   We had heard that the food here was outstanding but the food was okay but not great for the price so only three stars because of the average food.

1TZJaSph2tVvnd1heW_X6w.text: My wife and I eat at this location every few months and typically spend $225.00 plus tip. Not anymore, never again will we step foot into this location. We where seated by 1 of 2 hosts, walked through the restaurant  and was greeted with hello's from 6 staff members. Seated outside, I took a pic of a table with a glass still with wine and plates/ not ours. We where seated at 4:25. I was excited, hungry, and ready for our dinner date to begin. I wanted the  VONGOLE POSILLIPO:  Fresh Manilla Clams, Garlic, Oil, White Wine, San Marzano D.O.P. Tomatoes To start.  Unfortunately we where not allowed to even begin the meal. No server came to us. Not to provide us with water. Not to speak to us about the specials. Not even to ask if we would like a glass or bottle of wine. NOTHING!!!! A busboy was seen, he cleaned up the table I had took a picture of earlier. After 25 minutes... I remind you, 6 staff members said hello as we where being seated, I said that's it. We walked back the way we came, where told goodbye by all the same people as we walked to the host/ bar in the front and handed our menus back to them. They asked if we enjoyed everything. I told them, "NEVER AGAIN will I spend money or step foot in thus place again! No-one came to serve us...25 minutes, and NOTHING!!!!" The hostess said "Are you serious?"   Quick note, there was one customer inside this entire time so its not like we lost in the crowd.  Service was non-existent so I cannot rate the food at this time.   We left still hungry walked across the street and ate at Totopo   That was great, Taco Tuesday!!! Great service, great Mexican food and overall a save to our night.   "NEVER AGAIN will I spend money or step foot in thus place again! No-one came to serve us...25 minutes, and NOTHING!!!!" 225.00 plus tip...GONE.

U_OXUlSDoN6H30K_Suog6w.text: What happened to this place?  I used to tell people to go, now I doubt if I'll ever head back unless for take out.  "Hello, my name is Bailey and I'll be taking care of you tonight." That was the first sign of horrendous service.  When a server uses generic statements, you know it's going to be bad.  "Do you want anything to drink other than water?"  Oh crap, it's all gone done hill quickly.  "We'll have a bottle of Etna Rosso, please!"  10 minutes go by before a glass was put on the table.    "Do you know what you want to eat?" We ordered two salads to share, a pizza to share and three pastas to share.  The wine finally comes!    The wine service:  Bailey may need training on this aspect of service.  First, she didn't present the bottle. Just came to the table and proceeded to open it. She cut the foil off and was perplexed to find the wax ring and tried to cut it out. Next she broke the cork while trying to pull it out.  No big deal, but awkward nonetheless.  She finally opens the bottle and pours the wrong person.  Tip: pour the person who ordered the wine.  Then she topped off the person she poured first. Another error.   Salads come out and were pretty good.  Anchovies were quite nice.  Empty salad plates sit on the table for a good ten minutes as we finish our wine. Now empty wine glasses sit on the table. Bailey is nowhere to be seen.  We flag down another server and ask for a wine menu. He brings it promptly.    We flag down Bailey and order a Montepulciano.   Five to ten minutes go by and the food comes out.. all of it at once.  You'd think they would course it out first. Maybe the pizza followed by the pastas. Nope. Everything at once.  The pastas are all very nice and the pizza was quite good.  Where's the wine we ordered 15 minutes ago?  We're almost through the food and decided to cancel the wine order.   I put this whole experience not on Bailey, but on the management of il Pizz.  Obviously, our server wasn't trained to serve at a somewhat upscale restaurant.    I don't really recommend this place after this experience.  Go next door if you'd like better food with excellent service.

ylPXHT1m7Tqk_ysl0RfhHA.text: We have dined here many times over the years and it is usually delicious and high quality food. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere is casual and good for family ties. The main dining room, however, is very cramped and the acoustics are terrible, making it very difficult to have a conversation with anyone.

gQLCEQbWRY8TIFqIpDFQMQ.text: I've had a variety of meals at this location since their inception many years ago.  The pizza is good and so are the Italian dishes. The problem is they're "just good". Much better than the location in Market Square but not the high level that they once were.  My last visit I had the cappelletti and the sage/butter/tomato mix tasted sour. Prior to that on another visit the gnocchi that was once triumphant in the land of restaurants claiming to make it homemade  actually had a frozen taste to it. I feel like they still make it onsite but freeze and perhaps I had an older batch.   Not sure I'll trek back out to my old stomping grounds of Mt. Lebo for this place any time soon.

K_8Fx7Mr8IX1aybkip7iQw.text: I came here with my family on Father's Day. With ten minutes of notice I was given a reservation for 6 in the midst of the holiday.     We ordered a montaro pizza (similar to the margherita but with thicker crust), vodka penne, and two margherita pies. The margherita pizza is Il Pizzaiolo's bread and butter - I could have eaten my weight in margherita pizza. Word to the wise: an adult (and most kids these days) can easily eat a pizza themselves. We finished up dinner with tiramisu and cannoli. I'm not a fan of cannoli but the tiramisu was fantastic.  The wine selection is large and beer options surprising. Our server, Lauren, was very knowledgeable and helped guide some of our table's decisions - can't beat that. I'd recommend this place as a nice break from any of the other beaten-to-death pizza options in the city.

8wDZjvF13_cl1dJrbt44ZA.text: Another five star experience, I love this place! We came here for a friends birthday dinner, and couldn't have been treated better! We sat at the bar, in the separate dining area, and had wonderful service & delicious food. Highly recommend, as always!

y4EOY5SMUPrJ7ldvG986CQ.text: Good luck getting a table. Always a two hour wait. I hear it's good, but I wouldn't know.

3jzgH_uj2tVx3sTQCT3f1Q.text: We came in on a night it wasn't busy and wow, we will be back! The service was good. The waitress was very friendly and helped us make selections. We ordered multiple courses and meals to share. The food was excellent. Delicious pizza! I didn't know my life was missing fried meatballs until I had them here. The ravioli was so good and the sauce is homemade, which I appreciate. The drink specials were creative and a good size. I'm dreaming about my next meal here. It is on the pricier side but the food and service and make it worth it.

xKWAhLK3rPPOrrGhQm2FSA.text: My husband and I have been eating at Il Pizzaiolo for many years. We've never had a bad meal here.  Our go to meal is usually start with a small house salad and split one of the pastas and pizzas.  My favorite pasta is their vodka pasta, however I don't think they carry it anymore.  The brick oven pizza is delicious! My only complaint about the pizza is just a little too much crust at the end. But I think that's pretty typical for brick oven pizza.  In the summer I recommend sitting outside on their back patio. It's very cozy! They also allow dogs if you sit at one of their tables out front on the sidewalk. Always a plus in my book! All around good restaurant and one of my go to places that never disappoints.

3cy5qcBkIiGklmiR4d0Tyw.text: I love and recommend Il Pizzaiolo to dine in. It's a swanky place for date night or to take the family or visitors out for a nice meal. Food is really good - I recommend the Arancini (get the meatless option, definitely tastier), the Caprese salad (insalata capresa), and the Pollo Limone for sure. Tasty options. Service isn't bad either.   Pickup though, is another story. Every instance I've called for pickup, they give me a time of 30 minutes, I get there, and it takes at least 20 minutes after I get there for me to get my food. Makes me wonder what the point of calling ahead is. Every. Time.   But this time, I'm a bit annoyed - I always get the Margherita Pizza, sometimes I'll get the Margherita DOC for the fancier mozzarella. The pizza was still tasty, but I'd expect a Margherita pizza to have more than 1.5 pieces of basil leaf when the general recipe for Margherita is mozzarella, tomato and basil. Also, same instance - ordered food, waited 18 extra minutes after arrival to pick up, and then my pizza was cold.   So, dine in, don't pick up.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margherita DOC pizza take out, with not a lot of basil.

Xl4bJED7DZ7JMOe2FQfHIA.text: I had a great evening here this past weekend. I would like to start with the overall ambiance of the place, which is both classy and trendy, and beautifully decorated. The service was top notch with friendly wait staff. We started with the burrata special, served with fresh tomatoes, basil and peppers, and then moved on to our main courses including the chicken with sweet sausage, branzino, and pasta bolognese. Of the three options, the branzino was my favorite, delicately cooked and simply tasty. The chicken was tender and juicy. We topped it all off with tiramisu, which was packed with soft marscapone cheese and pungent coffee taste. Overall great experience!

Zqq_8vxldXhpBxcTHZ4Auw.text: Their meatballs, Caesar salad, and a pasta dish or two are to die for. Their wine list, however, is severely lacking, for a connoisseur or an individual who just wants a beverage. And they try to be fancy and serve Italian, then do not educate their waitstaff on what in heaven's name they have in these overly light wines. In fact, my girls' nights out broke down early and regrouped a few minutes later at a tavern because the adult beverages at Il Pizzaiolo were so poor.

rvzuRVfcWwc4H0jsAQpRdA.text: My friend had the most terrible experience at this location.   The owner cursed her out (F U and all of your Mt. Lebo neighbors...to quote him).  Unacceptable and threatening behavior.  Not to mention $38 for 2 small pizzas!  Buyers beware!

TbhA1ldYsM1Xw4xpuBwluQ.text: For as many times as we have dined here I am very disappointed and will not likely return based on how we were treated today. Called for a takeout order and were told they were too busy to fill, to call back in an hour and a half. Did so, then was told a half hour more. Did so, and then told they would not do takeout for us. Could have said so on the first round so we could have eaten elsewhere. Very, very rude to have us keep calling back and then deny altogether. Very unprofessional and discourteous.

GOK8MxTssOHw4Ir8T8Px0w.text: The owner of Il Pizzaiolo is a perfectionist and it's evident in the quality of the food served All ingredients are imported from Italy  The wood fired pizza oven was built by a group of artisans who were flown in from Italy If you want authentic Italian food this restaurant is highly recommended They also have an extensive assortment of fine wines many from Sicily . The restaurant  has three venues the front restaurant with normal seating a wine bar where you can also have dinner and in warm weather outdoor seating on the patio  Great  Italian food excellent service A special experience . Five stars

MtUFXlIZP19sveVton6cBA.text: One of my favorite restaurants!!! Love the atmosphere in the wine bar. Really cozy. We always order the Penne Rosa

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Penne Rosa

g79SSMThBGGSUVtMOZLGLg.text: What a great surprise!  Italian food with a genuine punch! I'll be back because this is a great place to eat and the food is so authentic!!

bvITVgIFx2iKDElJoXHR-A.text: Read a lot about the restaurant and picked this place after a lot of deliberation - our first dinner out without the children !  To be honest - everything that we had today was just average - nothing that felt great , a few things that were not right and nothing that was just outright terrible .  The positives - the service . We were well attended to and decent recommendations were made where asked for . The negatives- price is on the higher side for the food and the ambience , the restaurant does not have great decor/ does not look fancy - I believe the restaurant in warrendale is much better. We ordered the Peach Bellini - seems like there were way too many house flies around - they found their way twice into the Bellini ! Good for them and not so good for us - the first time was without drinking a sip so was instantly replaced . We were not so lucky the second time around . Were not offered a replacement neither were we in the mood for one .  And now the average: we tried the Arancini ( rice balls) as they were recommended - maybe we did not have a taste for them but they were just average and nothing to rave about .  The pizza dough was super nice but the PROSCIUTTO E ARUGULA was just ok - for a $22 pizza you expect a little more flavor . Again - it wasn't bad but maybe we had higher expectations. Boxed a Tiramisu for home - just had some of it and nothing to complain .  So overall - just average and maybe not worth a second shot - lots of other places to try ! Would have been nice if we weren't asked to pay for the Bellini though :)

MEgD18oXuDDqktnrd2CQHA.text: have gone here many times and always enjoy it. Great quality food, good portions. Love the atmosphere too

jlw7F-C6ITwqrVLhcYx7XQ.text: When I was little I used to hate this place.  Too grown-up, pizza was "weird"....they didn't have Cherikee Red like Caruso's down the block.  Upon further review, the 13-year-old version of me was dead wrong.  It's authentic wood-fired brick oven pizza with high-grade ingredients. The buffalo mozzarella rules, the toppings are top-notch, and the crust is the type you can only achieve with this type of prep and this kind of oven, which is to say it's perfect.    I especially recommend the patio out back if it's nice out.  Also, the cocktails are shockingly good here. In particular, I'm a fan of the negroni because they chose Carpano Antica vermouth. There simply is no better way to start an Italian feast than with THE classic aperitif drink, and Il Pizzaiolo cared enough to serve a spot-on version.

KofW7cLGqJr_Yy0bsNU3BA.text: The food is alright.  Not great, but not offensive either.  The atmosphere and service definitely make this a great date night spot.  The wine bar in the back is fantastic.

F3FzFwV2Zbl1uiOy144CXw.text: Just way to expensive for what it is. It's good but not at the prices they choose. $9 for wedding soup? It was good, but not at that price and if I would've been told it was that much (was a special) I would've passed. Service was fine, but not attentive and slow, as well. Just so many other good Italian places in the area for half the price. Eggplant parm was enjoyable.

yTprGXmwIYxXiLMfF-9kKQ.text: By all means, dine at Il Pizzaiolo . Excellent food, service and atmosphere! Romantic back patio! We thought we were in Italy.

oJNSVBmB0gEnNAmaihohig.text: I've been to this location many times. Always have a True authentic Italian meal. Tried the lasagne this time and the flavor explodes with every bite. Awesome restaurant.

JJr_xi_xBiIUYE8IIAVFQg.text: Way overpriced for just ok food.  On a Tuesday night, there was a long wait.  The staff wasn't overly friendly, and when we had to wait, they simply pointed towards the wine bar.  Having never been there before, I was confused by having to pass through the outside to get to the bar.  While I thought the wine bar was cozy, the other customers there were rude and self-centered, ignoring polite "excuse me" by the waitstaff.   When we were finally seated, we waited about 10 minutes before a server appeared.  The food was prompt, and the salad was more than enough to share.  The pizza was simply ok.  I've had much better wood-fired pizza elsewhere.  Beware:  for just a party of five, they added a 20% tip onto the bill.  If you're going to add a tip to a bill, make it the customary 18%.  But frankly, I didn't think they needed to add the tip for us.  Also, do not use multiple credit cards.  I was charged for the entire bill on my card, even though we asked to split it between two.  I'm still waiting for my overpayment to be refunded by the restaurant...

jAyowyb_Dp_H-kX6p6Cscw.text: Il Piz has the best gnocchi in the Burgh!  I hear good things about a variety of things on their menu, but to be honest, I can never not order the gnocchi when I go here.   The food and ambiance at both their Mt. Lebanon and Market Square locations are above average.  The Mt. Lebanon location has a particularly nice, private patio with outdoor seating and a trendy, intimate wine bar.

8LeZ_Q4bfxsL_meLHp57gg.text: the pizza here is ***AMAZING***! And this is some serious pizza. The taste sensation takes you straight to Italy in your mind.  One of only 16 places in the US officially certified by the Associazione Verace Pizza Napoletana, they make the official Napolitan pizza, which adheres to strict guidelines. Here are some of them:  "The pizza has to be round. It mustn't be more than 13 inches in diameter. The crust has to be  of an inch at the most, and the center has to be less than a tenth of an inch high!  Naturally the dough must be kneaded by hand. Rolling pins and dough machines are just not acceptable."  Pretty frickin anal huh? But when you taste the pizza you realize the guidelines are right on. And must have been developed by some Italian dudes over several hundred years. Or you'd like to think that.  Unfortunately everyone knows about the amazing pizza, so its PACKED if you go on a weekend and I mean PACKED! Sadly they don't take reservations, its walk-in only.   On a Saturday night around 7pm it was choc full of suburbanite yuppy families and thirty-something double dates. If you are up to waiting for a long time in a tight space with these people in order to achieve pizza-heaven then go on a weekend. Otherwise I am sure lunch or a week night is less crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vera PIZZA official seal
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. inside of the restaurant

Mu_kRUca3sbm2vAXdvmmMA.text: Have I found my new favorite date spot? My fiancee and I just enjoyed dinner here last night and we were thrilled with every part of our experience at Il Pizzaiolo. We showed up pretty late, around 9:20pm and were provided with quick service from a friendly server.   I was pleased with their wine list- lots of great Italian reds. The Barbera d' Asti they have by the glass is excellent! We ordered the Carcuccieri pizza (or had a similar name- the one with artichokes and prosciutto) and loved every bite. Real wood-oven cooked thin crust pizza, with good quality toppings and San Marzano tomato sauce. Molto bene!  We parked on the street and were able to find a spot easily. Seemed like a pretty and safe neighborhood. When the weather is decent, dine outside on their back patio. It's gorgeous and romantic!

ITaTJRLOIqwlaYCvaClYIA.text: Went for a low-key, tryptophan-free lunch with out-of-town friends the Friday after Thanksgiving.  Good pizza, friendly service, bright space (if a little loud).  But I can't in good conscience give a higher rating to 12-inch, 4-cut pizzas that run $17 or $18, no matter how tasty they are.  The dough and prep are top notch, but the toppings were pretty ordinary -- not foraged wild mushrooms, shaved truffles or anything larks'-tongues-in-aspic rare and exotic, after all.

7akUBN3BNpnmhoHpJOhKjA.text: Honestly can't beat it for gnocchi or pizza. We get two casa salads, a margarita pizza with pepperoni, and the penne alla vodka (except we substitute gnocchi for penne) every time we go. We've tried other combinations. But this one never disappoints and is plenty for two. The vodka sauce is the best I've had and the pizza - better than any I've had in Chicago, New York, Miami, wherever. It's THE BEST. Wood fired pizzas have become a dime a dozen these days. But Il Piz is still number 1 in my book.

50A3BNUd6Yi1gOy1qZTu-Q.text: I called ahead to inform the manager I have special dietary needs.  I eat a low fat plant based diet.  (I only was going here because my friends love this place)  When I call ahead restaurants are always happy to accommodate my needs.  I am pretty simple, but some veggies aside without added oils, make me a mega salad or plant based plate.  I am happy to pay whatever they want for such accommodations.  The manager said it would depend on what they had left over. . .seriously!?!  I am amazed she could not arrange to put some veggies aside before they were prepped with oil.  She suggested chicken.  I once again had to remind her I am a vegan.  I am not looking forward to my upcoming dinner at this restaurant.

jYjMf3_OWrbctQQwRm__eg.text: We ordered 2 pizzas and both were less than fair. The Funghi had 4 uncut reconstituted shitakie that were like leather and two slices of button. The 2 tablespoons of sauce was really off putting in flavor and the dough was raw. The Marggherita had a lot of watery sauce no visible cheese and 1piece of basil with more raw dough. All this for over 40.00!!!. Our first and last experience with this restaurant.

-jHxnZPfKBfnno8tDbdyLg.text: Don't go in winter. Seriously.  It's so cold - like sit with your coat on cold. The food and wine are great, but the front dining room is miserable. So disappointed.

XjzmY4jpZuQ6hJCFPOEnzQ.text: I can only add to the already good reviews on Yelp. The outside area was very pleasant. The food was simply very good traditional italian. Highly recommended.

9_qa9W6XgC0godbmhdOWCw.text: Turns out I should leave behind the N. Hills and venture to the S. Hills for dinner just a little more often.  I consider myself to be an excellent judge of Italian food and this place was really good.  We ate dinner in the wine bar which is out back and up a set of stairs.  It was a little more intimate than the front dining area.    I'm a fan of sweet wines and there were a lot of drier options so I went with the blood orange martini and it was fruity without being overly sweet.  There were so many delicious meatless options on the menu that I was really debating what to order.  I LOOOOVE fresh mozzarella and basil, so it was like my own little slice of heaven.  I went with the rigatoni with eggplant, marinara, fresh basil and mozzarella.  I cleaned my very large plate and even used some of their bread to wipe it a little cleaner.  I'm eager to go back and try some of the other fare.  I also want to give mad props to our waiter who helped me make my choice and provided excellent descriptions of the food!  My only real complaint is the olive oil they serve with the bread.  It could use some flavor or seasonings or even just some parm and a little pepper.  The only bland item I tasted.   Also, the restaurant is a little pricey.  Not ridiculous but not cheap either (especially when you add on a drink).

_Llak5nHDsxgtap43g6L2g.text: Best pizza I've eaten in Pennsylvania, the Margareta with imported tomatoes and sauce is, in itself, amazing. Everything on the menu is memorable.  This place is, however crowded and can be quite noisy and they don't take reservations.  Somewhat food-allergy friendly, but no gluten-free pasta, and they could improve a bit on this.

rYJZokgSX-RwOhbOsQrMfA.text: Growing up in Mt. Lebanon, I went to il Pizzaiolo years ago, but haven't been back in recent memory. I don't remember much about it before, and after my experience there last night, I will remember not to go there again.  We were celebrating my friend's birthday. We got there about 7:45 with a party of 5, and there were a few tables open. The only table that was large enough to accommodate us, a table for 8, was available in the back. The brunette hostess starts to take us back there, but then the blond hostess says "we have a large party coming in and they're going to be eating and drinking for a while." She points to a small table for 4 and says "You'll sit there." Confused because the restaurant allegedly doesn't take reservations, we offered to wait until one of the 6-person tables opens up. The blond hostess refused.   Paragraph in which I rant about the blond hostess: This girl can't be older than 17. The whole time she interacted with us, she was rude, dismissive, and acted like it was a bother for her to be doing her job. She gave us so much attitude, like she was doing us a favor by seating us at all. No wonder people always comment on how bad the service is at this place - if your first impression is with a condescending high schooler who needs an attitude adjustment, it would take a lot to negate that first impression. Also, someone needs to tell this girl that tights are not pants. If I wanted to see someone's a$$ while I ate, I'd go to a strip club. /end rant  We were seated at the tiny 4-person table, two people on one side of the table (who wants to eat with a corner of the table sticking into their chest, as the hostess arranged the seats?). The 8-person table sat vacant for the first hour we were in the restaurant, and we were almost done with our meal when the allegedly expected party came. Funny how they don't take reservations, yet they would not sit us at the only table available that would accommodate our party.  Our server, Ryan, was great and attentive. I think he realized how pissed off we were at the hostess and put in some extra effort.  As for the food and drink, it was just fine. Severely overpriced, but fine. Piccolo Forno is much cheaper (and is BYOB) and has much better food.   There are so many options in downtown Mt. Lebanon that there's no reason to put up with bad service, attitude, and mediocre, overpriced food. I won't be coming here again.

31F908sWCspdikmO9OtMgg.text: Wood fired Neapolitan pizza and pastas.   Love the Wine Bar.  Many Italian wines to try, although a little pricy. The Wine Bar is in the building in the back, go thru the back door and up the steps.  They have a little fire place with one log burning.  Nice place to sit and sip wine.    Had to wait to be seated in the restaurant so went to the wine bar and met a few different people - the people were all very friendly and made it seem like we were regulars.  Had the Doc Margherita pizza. It was very good with fresh buffalo mozzarella and basil.  Have been here a few times and have tried some pasta's and other pizza's and have found some to be very good but others were rather bland...so the consistency may not be there.  Il Piz. does have a quite a few different specialty style pizza's and seem to have mostly fresh ingredients.  I can see why people really like this place and return.  Service was fine for a crowded restaurant.  Was a little loud.

iHfy9wZShOKQvaLqcT-4hg.text: My family and I love this restaurant! Delicious food and wine bar has a great atmosphere!

yqPuameTcfFMPRydDOznDw.text: I love the downtown location. I was in Mt Lebanon on a Saturday at 4pm. Total down time and was totally ignored by wait staff while seated in the patio. Several wait staff walked by and waited on others seated after us. The place had very few people but a lot of wait staff standing around. Walked out so not sure how food compares to downtown but can say hands down a much better staff downtown and will go somewhere else when I'm in Mt Lebanon.

XyDWgpN732No0_chug3GJA.text: This didn't live up to my expectation, based on reviews. Atmosphere is loud, busy cafe feel, not my preference. Service was average, the server a little aloof, minimal conversation..all okay, but the pizza didn't impress me, and WAY to expensive for quality of what you receive. The pizza is cooked in wood oven, but dough still soggy, not bad, but not worth 18$ for a pizza  (all pizzas are about size of an appetizer somewhere else). Note, no fountain soda, so 2$ for 8 oz.bottle coke..so place is average at best, nothing outwardly wrong, except the price indicates a pretty decent place but quality is that of a quick cafe pizza that should be 10$, not 18$+.

7kC3RbXgKzymw7QbwsvMBA.text: This used to be one of my absolute favorite places to eat. However I had such horrible service here on my last outing that I will NEVER return here again. The server was rude and ungrateful. She reminded me of Lindsay Lohan filming her reality show.  The atmosphere in the wine bar is fabulous and the food is decent. I really like the pizza and marinated vegetables. The meatballs are also excellent. Sadly I cannot support a business that provides such poor service.

OzllW5r8t_NzgkfZW4LEZA.text: Greatest italian food around! Their portions are not too big and the quality is great. Homemade pastas and pizza. Amazing caprese salad and fresh desserts! The service is great. Our server was very helpful with reccommendations and what to order, he did not dossapoint! Will definitley be back to try more!

ifDvpo5cOhcOiiRz2FeU2A.text: Wow I've found Italy in the suburbs of Pittsburgh.  Great food, very authentic Italian offering and taste. Good wine list.  Come with friends and enjoy a great meal.

PDZSIiY4L_Zjee-pWj8EAA.text: Excellent food.  Overpriced though.  This would be a five star review however the restaurant is a fairly casual restaurant with prices that exceed what is customary for this type of restaurant.

huE0d3lrz4euiPOmJCqfcw.text: My FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT IN PITTSBURGH! It's the sauce, people. The sauce!! So good.  Order the mussels with marinara. Then order whatever else you want because it's going to be amazing.

sd5S4Od7jCGT2qVj2p-aQg.text: So delicious, alil pricey but everything I have had is amazing.

UVxi6rUWUlkzSrcChkXCyw.text: I have been wanting to check out Il Pizzaiolo for a while now and glad we got the chance to on a random Monday night. The place is small inside and we lucked out just walking in but I would recommend trying to get reservations for a Friday or Saturday.  Our server was great and knew a ton about the entrees and patiently explained each one to us.  They have a small draft selection so if you like wine this is the place to go. Being a beer drinker I went with a Hoegaarden.  While we waited for our entrees we were served 2 large pieces of cooked pizza dough that had salt and olive oil on them. I think they ran out of bread but this almost homemade breadstick was fantastic!  Our entrees arrived promptly and I went with the rigatoni which came with 3 meatballs. The sauce was a great combo of sweet/savory and the meatballs were delicious.  My family member ordered one of the pizzas which came with arugula and prosciutto-it was enough for 2 meals and great to take home.  The prices are reasonable for a finer Italian restaurant.  Great place for date night.

R1YLMw_0K7x0uVhN6_W-Gg.text: Rating is based largely on the snottiness of the staff.  We weren't sure if children or non-locals were not appreciated.  We walked into a virtually empty restaurant at 6 on a Monday; got the once over; and the hostess said "i hope you have a reservation.  We have a big crowd at 6:30. You can wait for 45 minutes at the wine bar." We walked outside and easily booked a reservation on Open Table for 6:15, so we walked back in and were seated right away.    Food was ok--puttanesca tasted like yellow mustard but caprese was awesome.  We repeatedly got dirty looks from the staff throughout our meal though.  I should mention that when we arrived a family with small children were leaving after finishing their meal and they had a stock-pile of high chairs in plain view, so it was not unreasonable to bring our well-behaved girls (6 and 2 yrs old).  By 6:30, there were still a number of empty tables.  If you're not from Pittsburgh, there attending college or joining your college-aged child or have small children, I would avoid this place.

eWHhM-a1VrGSwJ1O0YOpgw.text: The atmosphere and food are GREAT! The arranchini appetizer is a must try. The wine bar is the best seat in the house. The blue grata martini is my favorite. The back patio is really nice too. I like this location much better than downtown.

UchK5BrDlvMPsZ2L-eZ6Ig.text: Food is above average however the service isn't the greatest. Took 20 minutes to get a drink. Waitress seemed irritated she had to serve us which I don't know why because our bill was $400 and she would get a nice tip from us. I have served before for 5 years and I know what it's like to be busy on a friday night but at least pretend like you want to be there. For the money that was spent was not worth it. May go at a less busier time during the week.

LnFpJu_piRAnRi0G-aPjiw.text: We had an amazing bachelorette dinner last night .  The manager Stacy took excellent care of us .  The food was perfection.  The pizza , meatballs and grilled vegetables were delicious .  You will not find better Italian food in Pittsburgh . I am 100 percent Italian -so trust me on this opinion . Wine list is also impressive .  Thank you to Ben , Stacy and the entire staff for providing and special dining experience .

oJEHlmY5PgHsmKVwgVeEnQ.text: The restaurant is too pricey for what it offers. The food was very mediocre. We ordered three different dishes - they looked and tasted exactly the same. The pasta was drowning in oil. Very disappointing.

LjNYsnqVPe8g1MO8rDWgQw.text: ll Pizzaiolo never dissapoints! Everything from the food to the atmosphere makes for a great dining experience. If you are looking for authentic, not to mention delicious Italian food, II Pizzaiolo is the place to go. Highly recommend the Tortelloni!

bPQ5P2E9lnb8fs-LNSDRgw.text: I visited Italy recently and when I came back I decided I wanted to try to find some similar quality Italian food here in Pittsburgh now that my standards are higher after having the real deal.  Pizzaiolo did not disappoint.  They had a pasta with an all'Amatriciana sauce I had only seen before in Italy, and I also had their lasagne bolgnese and a fresh buffalo mozzarella appetizer.  All were amazing and on par with the quality I found in Italy.  They also had a nice selection of Italian craft beers which I've never seen anywhere else in the US before.  I just wish they'd include some English descriptions of them on the menu!  All the staff there is also very friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere feels more like a gourmet brick oven pizza place than a nice Italian restaurant, but they definitely have a lot more to offer than their pizza (which is also excellent).

9hKGFvHZUQFPGdT6wZkTeA.text: Came here for dinner when we first moved to Pittsburgh and we loved it. The food was super tasty and the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. I loved the huge stone pizza oven

v1CXMdSfTS9iFriV9gvc7A.text: I wanted to give this place a "5" but then thought "they should be more generous with their fresh basil this time of year."  (After this past winter we are really craving our Summer herb garden).  This is not an indictment of the quality of the food or experience as all portions were wonderfully seasoned and the staff was overly competent and nice/non-pretentious.  I enjoyed the Italian food menu and Italian wine/beer menu.    I'm not religious but I said a quiet "thank-you" to the stars for not letting us walk out of the place when we were told we would have a 10 minute wait.   It was a Friday night (and we expected some congestion uptown).  We were redirected to wait in the adjacent wine bar, where we happily stayed to wait out our 10 minutes- but we decided to leave after 7 minutes (thinking we could find "somewhere else").  Upon exit we thanked the hostess and asked her to take our names from the wait list.  At that time the hostess informed us that we could be seated right away and that they were beginning to look for us.  We stayed, thankfully.  In addition to the Belgian beer and the Italian Summer wine we ordered the Caprese Salad and the Margherita pie.  It was wonderful to receive the appetizer with enough time to enjoy it before the pie arrived because the salad was worth savoring for awhile.  Tasty tomatoes, fresh Basil, and a wonderful, almost mushy, *Mozzarella ball.  The pie was a wonderful blend of a lively aromatic sauce, gently melted slices of Mozzarella cheese, and various stages of wood fired dough throughout.    *The Mozzarella seemed to be crafted in house.  Really fresh and ripe.     Ours was a great experience (food, service, etc.) on a hectic night.  I'm so glad we stayed.  Not too pricey.  Essentially what you would expect to pay for a fine dinner on a Friday night.  Also, the Olive Oil was remarkable, probably a mid to high end Greek.  We would have enjoyed a little more of the Olive Oil in addition to the fresh basil.

rndvR-y-1q95unx5V4XFAg.text: Paid $54.00 for a very average plate of rigatoni and something called a meatball. Wife had a lemon chicken dish that was too salty to eat however dogs seemed to like it. Place was dirty, loud , confused. Never so ripped in my life. Never recommend and never go back. One star for waitress.

VpBPFMRH9T_RzdzZyAJiXg.text: II Pizzaiolo has long been on my radar as a new place to try.  Who doesn't love a little Italian?  (Well, I divorced one, but that's a whole 'nother story not fit for Yelp).  So, when I got the chance to show up here, I was very excited!  We made a reservation for a weekend afternoon, so not necessary, BTW.  The interior is shall we say cozy?  We got our pick of tables.  Service was meh.  Our service acted bored until we mentioned that this was our first visit, then we were given her high energy sales pitch, "delicious food created using old-world techniques and the high quality ingredients.  Most menu items are hand-made and if they are not, they are imported from the best sources".  Did she forget anything?  I hope not!  Wait, there is more, "the mozzarella is direct from Naples".  That's more like it, gf, show some enthusiam!  Lots of great choices on the menu!  BJ got the Chicken Cacciatore and I got the lasgana.  Our server warned us of the extra wait time for my meal.  No problem, I was willing to wait for this classic homemade dish!  Unfortunately, it did to live up to my expectations.  First off, it was served lukewarm.  Back to the oven for my dish!  It was a little better the second time around.  Nothing special about the sauce or meat.  BJ liked his dish, too.  But really nothing special.  All in all, a decent meal.  Maybe we ordered the wrong things.  But we had nothing that we would make us want to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Cacciatore
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cold lasagna
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bellini &amp; Moretti

52kIlh9T4WibmxsljS862w.text: Awesome Place!  The pizza is pretty good - I like mine a little more well done (must pass the stand test).    They use fresh ingredients.      I think what made the place for me is the wine bar.   Awesome bartender / awesome crowd.    I liked the fireplace in the wine bar (especially on a negative degree night).  Recommendations: - Pizza - Meatball Appetizers   I have heard good things about the pasta - I will be back.

gfdu8E5EtcXEjOl3CO7khg.text: Service was very friendly and the food was fantastic. The pizza is cooked in a wood fire over and I highly recommend it. Be aware that most items on the menu are expensive side.

iHHOi161GVG3aoZQxktApg.text: Il Pizzaiolo is dishing out some serious Italian food. Quite unexpectedly they also make the best Neapolitan pizza I've had, though to be fair I've never been to Naples. A deliciously thin and chewy crust, but not crispy, Neapolitan crusts should never be crispy. The pizza may be the star of the show, but the rest of the offerings are also delicious. The fresh burrata appetizer is wonderfully creamy. The arancini are good, but would maybe benefit from a bold and spicy saucy. Don't sleep on a classic, the chicken Marsala was seriously excellent. I hear most of the pasta is housemade and since I didn't have any, I have a reason to stop back the next time I'm in PGH.

1qCgO4OhaTB1j2CW0JhCgw.text: I actually really enjoy the wine bar behind the actual restaurant. Since it is considered a wine bar in that particular portion of the restaurant, I would except more wine by the glass, no matter the price. I would pay $$$$ for wine by the glass, so I know I like it and then would pay $145 for a bottle.  Then there's the main restaurant that I really wasn't that impressed with. We were sat at the table with the most slant...which there were other open tables for two with No slant. Our glasses were sliding down the table so we used our silverware to stop them from sliding. No joke! The food I ordered was penne alla vodka, which was pretty tasty. But for $18, and that's all you get?! I've had better. The bread wasn't impressive, just sliced up sour dough bread with not so high end olive oil. (You can taste the difference between a really good olive oil and a bulk cheap kind).   Having said that, I will certainly return to the wine bar for maybe a glass of wine and try maybe the pizza, but not the main restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine selection
Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine bar.

4dF6MgjMS2NAsMeA9RiIGA.text: WORSE PIZZA & very expensive!  Frozen pizza much better, plus what a bunch of stuck up bourgeois employee attitudes!

o1OTMPmzbxaalgm8NIv2NA.text: Great service, great food and great wine! Don't forget to check out the wine room and lounge!

cL4K503WyE_wy7clOQmQXA.text: Where do I begin... we were told there would be 15 minute wait. Well an hour later still not seated, so we asked the hostess how much longer the wait would be, she said another few minutes. We waited another fifteen. Meanwhile looking around the restaurant empty tables everywhere. The hostess stated they were for reservations, now previously in the day I visited the website only to see that they did accept reservations so that rubbed me the wrong way. I wanted to leave but the group I was with wanted to stay. Finally we asked the hostess how much longer? To which she responded "just sit them some where" . Which mean me feel totally awkward and totally unwelcome. The food was mediocre at best and expensive. I will never patronize  this establishment again, due to the way I was treated. If you take reservations let people know on your website and treat people who want to come your restaurant with respect.

We4Ip4cXHm7bdmEgx581KQ.text: Their neopolitan style pizzas will blow your mind.  They are by far the best you'll find in the greater Pittsburgh area.  Other things I've tried here include the mussels, the lasagna (a serious choice for meat-lovers... comes with both sausage AND meatballs), and the tiramisu.  All were delicious.  I have yet to try something bad here!  The best place to dine, in my opinion, is the back patio...if you can get a seat there and the weather permits.  It is gorgeous and peaceful and has a very European feel about it.  A bonus for dog-lovers is that they will let you have your pup back there with you (leashed and on good behavior).  One of the few back patios in Pittsburgh that will allow it!  Not only that, but the staff LOVES dogs and will provide doggie water and petting ;)  The wine bar is also very cute.  It is a bit dark for dining, but it's super cozy and a great place to hang out and drink.  On busy nights, you will have an easier time getting a table here than in the main room or patio.  They have a huge selection of italian wines and a wide range of prices to suit any budget.  Service has never been short of satisfactory here in my experience, even on busy nights.

R14hHyYDIPYn6oR9XkEmUg.text: An hour and half later and we are still waiting on food.  Waitress hasn't checked on us in half an hour.  Would rate the food, but have no clue because we are still waiting.  Ridiculous.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nothing on the table, 90 minutes later.

5RKAHBoZq4zNPcH2n8sUDA.text: We were in Dormont for the Beatles " Eight Days A Week" screening at the Hollywood Theatre.   That was so good.   Sadly the food that followed was not.  As far as I know the sauce is the thing.   It was not here.   O well!  Definately will drive by next time!   Service tried but something was going on in the kitchen.  They took care of my entre and the pizza that replaced it but i would have preferred a delicious meal...esp since i was hungry and there's nothing better than eating good food when you are hungry!!!

TCJwAa4Rsu0j8jCXoqE-CQ.text: I dined here on Friday and despite some issues with the service/kitchen, I will definetly be back.  We were able to get a table without reservations or a wait at around 6pm on a Friday which was a pleasant surprise!  The restaurant is nice and cozy inside, if a bit loud.  My friends were already dining on the fried cheese balls, which were described by the waiter as "an explosion in your mouth of cheesy goodness."  cheesy goodness explosion?  sign me up.  I'm not even going to try to act like a refined foodie I will do damn near anything for cheese and brother, we had CHEESE.  they brought bread out, and it was pretty good but not interesting bc it did not contain cheese.  I ordered the chicken piccatta, one friend had chicken cacciatore, another had the lasagna, and then my healthy vegetarian friend had some dish of marinated vegetables.  who the hell cares about marinated vegetables?  that was the one dish I did not sample as it did not contain cheese.    The wine list was also very good and the waiter knew what he was talking about and I did not find the upcharge outrageous.  The chicken cacciatore was pretty good.  Here's the thing:  my friend who got it alwyas plays it cool so she was all, "It's alright."  I tasted it, and it was good as hell!  Its hard to mix sausage and chicken in one dish but this was pretty good.    My friend has the lasagna and it was so good as soon as I took a bite I was so overwhelmed by how good it was I smacked him in the shoulder.  It was AMAZING.  I dont know how it is sooo good, I think it is layered with alternating layers of cocaine, love, and cheese.    In a lame attempt to be healthy, I ordered the chicken piccatta.  When a waiter says, "you know, its good but here's what I recommend..."  I need to learn to recognize that for the "get something else!" that statement is.  For some reason my entree came out 10 min after everyone elses. I ordered it bc I thought it would be healthier than heavy pasta but it was swimming in a lemon butter sauce that was not healthy but very good.  There were capers in the dish too and they were the only thing interesting about it.  This dish was pleasant but unremarkable and underwhelming.  Get something else.  Ask the waiter what to get and then trust his judgement.  I will def be back, and the next time I am back I think I'll try the pizza that they are so famous for.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you have not been there..

IS199Y7gRlyRaTuN6wbZNA.text: Giving this place an iffy three stars because we left feeling very unwelcome. Overall the food was good, with the exception of the olive oil dipping sauce. Wedding soup was very good! However, If your planning on stopping in for early lunch with more than 5 people, prepare to play Rock Paper Scissors on who's going to pay the bill. Nowhere was it posted or was communicated to us in the beginning that parties of 6 or more will share one bill. If it was, we would have asked the waitress at the beginning on how she could accommodate us since we all had debit cards. When it came down to pay the bill, we asked if we could get the checks split into 4 different checks since it was not busy at all, but we were immediately given attitude and told no. Finally she gave in an had split the checks. Overall, our waitress did not seem like she wanted to be there or to be serving us to begin with. I suggest that ownership re-evaluate staff and how they present and represent their business..

tnXbzS7T1sca6uQlA0P_lQ.text: This restaurant is going downhill.  I used to frequent this location years ago, and loved it!  I returned a few months ago, to get treated to an overpriced, underwhelming experience that led to both myself and my date getting food poisoning over bad mussels.  By the way, it was a first date, nothing says "go out with this guy again"  like being glued to your toilet the entire next day praying that you'll just die.  I called them, and told them what happened (specifically stating I wasn't looking for a handout, I just wanted to let them know that their mussels had turned, and they should check their product), and the manager told me that I had to have been mistaken, and that they only keep in fresh ingredients.  They did send me a $15 gift card, which I thought was nice even though that a $15 gift card is the middle finger of gift cards, so I decided to try them once more.  OK, so that was just a fluke, they gave me a gift card, time to put on my optimistic pants and try again.  So I took one of my long time friends out for lunch.  We walked in, and we were given the new option to sit in the "Wine Bar".    OOOooo, color me intrigued.    So they took us outside, up some stairs, and into what I'm guessing was a middle aged Persian's studio apartment above a garage that they converted into a dining room.  We then waited for service for an inhuman amount of time before we were given waters.  I ordered a dry red wine, and my friend ordered a cocktail.  We waited, and eventually got those, and they were actually very nice.    We ordered mussels again (cringe) and the meat and cheese plate.  First thing I knew was iffy was the meat and cheese plate.  They replaced the normal wooden board, and replaced it with a plate.  A white, boring, incredibly small plate.  On top of it all, it was more of a plate of lunch meat than a charcuterie!  Blah.  The mussels were good though, and my bowels remained intact, though we asked for bread when it was dropped, and had to ask for it a second time.  What a waste, the broth was actually good, but cold by the time we actually got our bread.  So I'm sorry Il Pizzaiolo, I really tried to like you, but until the quality returns, I won't be.  TL;DR  Don't go here, there are a ton of cheaper, better Italian restaurants in Pittsburgh

lanvklhn4jTPZXEJaSZvdg.text: After several disappointing trips to the Il Pizzaiolo in Market Square, I had heard good things about the Mount Lebo location and decided to give it a try. I went with Turkish Engineer (TE) on a snowy weekend evening. We dined rather early, so there was no wait. Unfortunately throughout the meal, I noticed almost the same (if not more) problems with service and food.   Our drink (two sodas) and appetizer orders were taken almost immediately (great!). But we were not given silverware or napkins and for some reason could not possibly distract our waitress to obtain any. We snagged some from a nearby empty table instead. My soup and TE's frittatine arrived a short time later. The wedding soup was delicious, with savory meatballs, spinach, and orzo. I did ask for some parmesan cheese to put in the soup, and our waitress shook exactly half a teaspoon over the bowl and quickly departed. Since when is parmesan cheese a limited commodity? The way the servers at Il Pizzaiolo protect the freshly grated parm, you'd think it was made of gold flakes. But I digress. The frittatine (fried pasta with bechamel sauce and cheese) was quite bland. After a few bites, we had it wrapped to add tomatoes and herbs at home.   Then our pizzas arrived; I ordered the margherita doc (mozzarella, basil, and tomato sauce)  and TE chose the funghi (mushroom). My pizza, (despite it being short on the basil), was very tasty. TE was upset to find he was served not a pizza with mushrooms, but one with sausage instead. He asked if he had ordered correctly, and I said that he had. Even the patron next to us said that TE had indeed ordered the mushrooms. The waitress seemed a little unnerved but quickly had the kitchen make a new pizza.   Overall, a disappointing dining experience. It took forever to get water and any other items we needed for our meal.  We tried to be patient, as we only saw two servers working. However, there were three hostesses at the bar chatting and seemingly doing nothing. The restaurant was by no means crowded (this was a Sunday). Moreover, what is the point of having three hostesses and two overworked servers? It doesn't make sense.   I will speak up for the quality and freshness of the ingredients. Everything is freshly made, especially the pizzas. That is great. But otherwise, the food and service at Il Pizzaiolo is severely lacking.

QkhbLSWuDR_4LM57qThXAw.text: Atmosphere is really the only reason to rate it above 1 star.  The menu was difficult to read (could be that it was just not familiar to me).  The salad was ok but the house dressing was basically just oil with some bland herbs.  The pizzas took forever to come out and when they did they were soggy in the middle which meant I had to cut and scoop with a fork.  Not the way a $20 pizza (10" diameter) should be.  The server was very nice but anytime we needed anything he was nowhere to be found and took a long time to find him.  I don't plan on being back anytime soon.

i50x-TDHzIR3munjswgFNg.text: This place was recommended to me by a colleague while I was here on business. I am glad I went. I had the pleasure of being waited on by Gina and Spencer. Ok, I will just say it; Gina is a goddess. You could watch her all day lol. Anyway, I didn't care for the original recommendation but I believe it's because I am used to chain italian food and not the real thing. Sensing my dissatisfaction , spencer recommended what I should have ordered in the first place... PIZZA. O....m.....G!!!!!! Writing this review at 10:30 am is making my mouth water thinking about it. When I was a kid, this pizza place by our house used to make the best pizza that my mother and I used to love to eat. Since then, now here's come close. The nostalgia that I experienced as I smelled and tasted this stuff almost brought on hyperventilating. Amazing food and impeccable service.   From a Detroiter to you; I truly enjoyed my experience and my meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Pizzaiolo - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside

uePoAP0p9OmpZp5IQZ3e8w.text: Absolutely wonderful. Heather the manager set up their back wine room for our hockey team and parents for lunch with little notice.   Worked out fantastically and everyone was thrilled with the food and service.  Best place around!

Dg3zHI4Y_iWqNtH_4jMwCQ.text: I loooooovvvvveeeeeed Il Pizzaiolo... my only reason for not giving it 5 stars, she did not warn us not to get two pizzas just for the two of us :)  Considering that they were not that busy, she seemed a little put off by questions so we just ordered and hoped for the best.  The food was so good though, I can see past the not so service oriented attitude.    We went here for lunch one Saturday when we were running around, and I have to say, I enjoyed it far more than I had expected that I would.  We each got a salad, and we each got a pizza.  We both were very happy and satisfied.   I think that my pizza was perfection (Margherita).  One of the best that I have ever had!    The only complaint... I had a glass of wine too and for a lunch, we spent $75... a little excessive.  Next time we would be able to get away with one pizza :)    I am excited for the downtown location to open up... and be able to go have a dinner where I can justify the expense a bit more!

SNBoeNjfkpPcG__ruQI6JQ.text: On my second adventure to this wonderful restaurant, my expectations were met yet again.  It was a busy Friday night, but we just headed up to the wine bar to enjoy cocktails until our table was ready. I had a yummy wine, and my BF had an amazing margarita. When we were seated our server was friendly and let us know about the days specials. Throughout the meal, while he was quite busy, we were not neglected and I always had a full glass of wine. :) I decided on gnocchi and my bf went with a pizza....both we so delicious. Their food is just amazing, I could not rave about it enough.  I've seen people complain that sometimes they have to wait to be seated, but don't let this deter you from trying this amazing restaurant!

IOfHHSJ3toRYz65KLy2JDw.text: This restaurant is extremely noisey and not so kid friendly.  The pizza may have been OK but for the fact the 2 we ordered with both soggy.  Over priced and over rated. But good if you want to be waited on by a bunch of high school kids.

l7IepdR6Bm93U6a7a4JB7Q.text: love it.  for the food, the people, the atmosphere, the drinks, etc.  regardless who i'm with of if it's take-out, my stomach and i are always happy afterwards.  the house salad is always a must for me, as there's just something so good about it.  my two favorite pasta dishes are the pesto and penne alla vodka.  when all else fails, those make up for everything else.  the margherita DOC is a staple.  always a winner.  i'm also a big fan of the wine bar...with or without food.  always a good time.

mCaAH-W4IOl58mQ4BLppWQ.text: Okay, okay, I finally get it. I've been told about this place for years and finally stopped in on Friday night around 8 PM.  I guess I'm not the only person who likes pizza on a Friday night because it was packed.  However, we were escorted out back to a beautiful wine bar with great dark lighting, comfy furniture and additional seating.  THe bar itself was pretty small, maybe 8 seats and the place was packed.  It didn't affect our service which was quite good and no one in the group waited for a drink.  The crowd was (I hate this word) "trendy" and most were laughing and having fun.  THe wine seemed to be relatively reasonable priced, however I'd like more options than just italian wine.  We sampled a charcutterie platter which was amazing.  The meats were top notch and flavorful.  The hummus and olives were some of the best I've had and the buffalo mozzarrella was to die for. The best I've ever had.  After a few drinks we were able to secure a table for 6 in the front and the server was prompt and friendly.  Wow, the pizza truly the best I've had in the burgh'.  I love mineos, aiellos, and fioris as much as the next but this is in a different league.  We ordered the neoplolitan pizza which is very simple, light, thin crust and amazing flavor.  As another yelper mentioned this is one of only 16 pizza places in the states to be certified to serve authentic neopolitan pizza.  We also tried some of the other pasta dishes, which were very good but again go for the pizza.  It's one of the best pies I've had coast to coast and I'd stack up against Ray's or any other historic pizza joint in NYC.  I'd give it 5 stars if it had better parking and a better wine selection.

dqkC9QTehWsUbpC23cKRQQ.text: A little pricey (especially the salads), but they make excellent pizza.  The main dining room can get loud, so for a quieter meal opt for the wine bar in the back.

ZYKIsWt3TZ1TycSf6lSagA.text: I checked out this place this evening before I went to a show at Destinta.  Yelp scores another good suggestion - this place is everything an Italian restaurant should be, with an interesting twist.  As I walked in, I saw exactly what I love to see in an Italian restaurant - tables placed relatively closely together in an intimate setting, but not close enough to feel like you're sitting on top of someone's lap.  The decor was also contemporary with a traditional flair.  What I didn't expect was the hostess informing me that I can wait at the wine bar if I'd like - what a welcome twist.  Out of the back of the restaurant and into what should have been someone's kitchen, was a wonderfully decorated wine bar and lounge, with a small seating area adjacent to it.  It was nice to sit back and relax for a few minutes and take in everything.  The wait time wasn't too bad for a Saturday night at 6:30 pm, my guess it was only like 15 minutes (but I think that was because a large party had ended up leaving, but who's counting =) )   Anyway, after being seated I ordered the pizza (like everyone else who left reviews).  and it was out of this world awesome.  I laughed because I spent as much on the wine as I did on dinner.  I ordered Tiarmisu for dinner, which was perfect.  For two people going out on a Saturday night, spending under sixty bucks to have dinner, drinks, and dessert is pretty unusual.  This place is a real find and everyone should check it out.

KsIOKPgve413IaSijLNuFQ.text: The pizza at Il Pizzaiolo was fantastic.  We ordered 3 pizzas: the Margherita, the Bianca, and the fennel sausage and rapini pizza (I forget the menu name).  My favorite was the Bianca - the ricotta cheese pushed it over the top.  The ambiance was very nice as well.  We sat in the outdoor seating in the back, which had a perfect combination of sun and shade.  The reason I gave a 4 star rating was for the somewhat slow and inattentive service.  I can't say that the service is typically like this, but we had a waitress in-service who was still learning and IMO, a bit overwhelmed.  But otherwise, I would highly recommend Il Pizzaiolo.

5f17dTLy7QJEKd0doKKcWg.text: It's what you'd get in better pizzerie in Italy.  Ron has many of his ingredients shipped from Italy.  It's a light, airy artisinal 12-13" pie that you can eat all on your own.  Our fave has been the prosciutto and arugula, but all the pies are excellent.  Pasta is also good.  We've had them all and the only one we've been disappointed was the all' amartricana.  The clam and the simpler preparations really let the pastas shine.  Wines are all Italian and feature numerous bottles from regions that are underrepresented in other Pgh restaurants.  Wines by the glass are fairly priced.  It's a definite 4.5, with the only flaws being a couple of pasta dishes that don't put the emphasis on the pasta itself.

AsTk-E3VEKz5O4tPefTrMQ.text: Probably one of the best places to eat pasta or wood-fired pizza...
